Reviews.Title: “Frustration!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before, & I now I remember what I disliked . It is very difficult to find the main entrance coming from the freeway on Boulder Hwy. I drove in circles in the dark . Once on the property, I could not find the valet parking. The valet chuckled like he has heard this scenario before. I go to check in, and it is about 8:00pm. There is one clerk & a line 6 deep. The customer at the counter was taking his time, so the line did not move. No one came out to help. Another 20 minutes. Difficulty finding rooms on 2nd floor. Had to ask for directions. If you want quiet, don't get a room over the atrium. Ice machine did not work. I got a no smoking room, but you can only ask at check in, not in advance. I only paid $35 for the night & a resort fee. Resort fees are the way now hotels in Las Vegas get more for the room. There is nothing at Sam's that qualifies as resort . The breakfast.at TGIF Fridays was not great. I should have stayed at Boulder Station. I would have been in my room probably 30 minutes sooner.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: pyiababe
Reviews.Content: i loved this hotel, was very clean very friendly staff. had everything bowling alley restuarants pool. it was a wonderful stay, i would go back in a heart beat. the xmas lights in the lobby and the mystic falls were out of this world. the only down fall is that its not on the strip. their is a shuttle but no late night shuttles back. but could not fault this hotel or its staff in any way.. i think it had the best lobby, better than all the ones on the strip..

Reviews.Title: “Another Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: saleswoman
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very comfortable and clean. We ate at Friday's - meals were very good. Close to all shopping - all in all 'Good Bang for your Buck'

Reviews.Title: “Tired, old, and boring”
Reviews.Author: Justin J
Reviews.Content: Sam's town used to be the go to off strip place for both tourists and locals alike. Well it seems this property is being neglected by Boyd Gaming for some reason. Dirty rooms, and casino floor. Tight low paying machines, and slow service. There are much better options on Boulder Highway.

Reviews.Title: “Very kind staff”
Reviews.Author: Persephoneo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sam's Town while I attended a conference. I found the staff were very courteous and the place was very clean. Food was provided at the conference, and breakfast was really sad - cold bagels and cold hard-boiled eggs. It wouldn't kill them to lug in a toaster. Lunch was very good, but a warm soup would have been appreciated. The banquet dinner was fabulous - the food at Sam's Town really is delicious. The rooms were quite cold. The clientèle consists mostly of elders, families and locals. It was pretty sedate and I was glad to drive to the Strip. The laser show is really strange - it's like disco wildlife Starlight Express or something...something worth seeing! Rooms are clean - mattresses are getting old and lumpy and could use replacement. Very reasonable cost, quiet, all in all - a good introduction to Las Vegas, but I'll probably stay on the Strip next time.

Reviews.Title: “O.K. hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linda36092
Reviews.Content: The hotel was O.K. but the airconditoner was not working properly and it was very warm as the outside temp the day we were there was a hot 96 almost a record breaker for Vegas this time of year. Would have had it checked out but had to check out at 3:30 AM to catch a early flight so only able to get about 4 hours sleep before we checked out. It would have been more pleasant to have been cooler. I will give them another chance if I need cheap accommodations off the strip in the future. Internet service in room was 10.00 for 24hrs we did not purchase. Guess they want you to gamble rather than in the room on computer Lol, we did not spend one penny gambling.

Reviews.Title: “fine times”
Reviews.Author: cookieEarpca
Reviews.Content: nice room and friendly staff. Most definetly worth the reasonable cost

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Week”
Reviews.Author: D H
Reviews.Content: At first I was a lilttle hesitant staying at a hotel so far away from the Las Vegas Strip, however I was pleasently surprised. What a great stay. The hotel staff was very friendly, locals galore.... and that wasn't a bad thing. Gambling was good, if I didn't know better I'd say we won more here then anywhere else. Really! Overall the hotel was clean and you didn't smell like an ashtray when you left. Restaurants we ate in were well staffed and clean, food was good. Entertainment besides gambling was abundant. We always found a band playing in a lounge, movie, bowling or Bingo. New garage's at the back of the hotel are very well lighted and convienent to building with a walk over. We look forward to returning to Las Vegas and we would stay at Sam's Town Hotel and Gambling Hall again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal and loads of fun!”
Reviews.Author: jandgpotts
Reviews.Content: We returned from Vegas last week and still telling stories of our fun at Sam's Town. Great service, roomy room with great view to beautiful atrium and laser show, So quiet and sleep was great. Beds could use a pillow top tho to be more comfortable. Options for dining very good. The buffet food and choices were quite surprisingly good. Great promos and coupons at the front desk just for asking. We were given an upgrade to higher floor and bigger room. Fun real people without all the glitz and glam--locals were all around. Entertainment in casino was 1st rate band-South of Graceland- and had everyone partying the night away. Big Big bowling alley open 24 hours. Easy access to strip as we had car and only two turns and 8 minutes to strip! Great rates!! Stayed three nights for the price of one night on strip! We will be back without doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, not wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Neeyana
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a conference. Conference rooms were freezing cold, everyone complained but management refused to fix problem. Food for conf breakfast consisted of hard boiled eggs in a bowl, Danishes, watermelon, and cantaloupe. Lunches: buffet style, all pre-fab food, dried out luncheon meats on a platter, stale breads. Shuttle service to airport runs twice a day only, and if the little van fills up, you're out of luck. We saw this happen to less fortunate folks than us.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable....”
Reviews.Author: fletch182
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here in the past, mainly based on price and cleanliness, this visit was no different. The room was clean, no major issues. We did a little gambling (slots) in the casino which was comparable to other casinos, a bit smaller and less crowded which suited our taste. We used a coupon (buy one slice, get on free) from the one's provided at check-in for dinner at Sbarro. The pizza was average but filled the void. We then used another coupon for a free scoop of ice cream (another BOGO) which topped off dinner. The female employee at the ice cream shop was new and a bit slow, which was understandable this being her first day and working alone. All in all it was another comfortable, albeit average, stay. Would recommend Sam's Town to friends.

Reviews.Title: “great place away from the strip”
Reviews.Author: monkey2009Cheshire
Reviews.Content: loved it here, hired a car so was easy to get to, they do free shuttles to the stip.it has a very relaxing atmosphere and is in a quieter area.plenty of dining options and free live music, also bowling alley and cinema.Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere to Relax and Still have FUN”
Reviews.Author: queenjansson
Reviews.Content: Went up with My husband to meet my parents and my Brother Flew in From Portland. Had a blast. Gambling and drinking without the crazyness of the regular vegas scene. Lots of fun!!! Beautiful atrium. Hotel Room nice and CLEAN! If I wanted to just relax do some gambling some drinking definatly would go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “barbill”
Reviews.Author: Barbara H
Reviews.Content: We love to stay here! Great personnel, rooms, food, lots of video poker & slot machines to choose from, terrific tournaments, other special events.

Reviews.Title: “Would maybe give 3.5 stars if I could”
Reviews.Author: Beebopabby
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple nights in March and it was overall a pretty good experience. Our flight was canceled which caused us to miss the first night of our reservation, and unfortunately the people at the front desk were not able to help us much because we booked a package trough HotWire. I was hoping they would be a little more understanding and give us some sort of refund, or at least some food comps, but nothing. The room was clean and fairly updated and the beds were nice and comfy. (I think anything would have felt great after spending the night on the floor at LAX) The AC in the room wouldn't go any lower than 76 which made it feel pretty hot and humid in there. It never got too bad, but it would have been nice if it worked a little better. The lobby was nice and the fake water fall/park area was a nice touch. I think this place is ideal for the older crowd or maybe kids. They have a laser light show that runs every few hours and it's pretty corny. It seemed like most people there were really getting in to it though. My 60 year old mom absolutely loved it There are quite a few food choices within the complex, but most of them close pretty early or were't even open at all when we were there, so we didn't eat very much at Sam's Town. The champagne brunch was very decent for the price. Cheap champagne, but you can't beat $10. We also had a late night meal at the grill. The food there was only okay, but the service was great. Everyone was very friendly and acted like they were happy to have us there. I liked the gift shop. It had wine and liquor at very reasonable prices and the souvenirs were pretty cheap too. The free shuttle was cool, but the last pick up is way too early, like 7ish. Sam's Town is not very close to the strip. $28 cab ride from The Flamingo. We never got to check out the movie theater or bowling alley. So anyway, I would probably recommend Sam's Town to anyone who is okay with staying off the strip and not looking for the full Vegas experience. The price was decent and the rooms were clean. I think this place is ideal for elderly people and maybe if you have a couple kids. I think next time I will definitely stay closer to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Sam's Town”
Reviews.Author: March97
Reviews.Content: Was very surprised at what was available here. Gambling,movie theatre, bingo etc. They have a lazer light show which is quite spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “All you want in one great Hotel/Casino”
Reviews.Author: RVManagerMesa_AZ
Reviews.Content: I love staying at Sam's Town Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas. I have previously stayed in their suites and they are first class...spacious, comfortable, have everything you could want, king bed, jacuzzi, frig, coffee pot, large shower, two big screen TV's, comfy large sofa, dining table and chairs, huge windows overlooking the indoor park....and the casino has all the fun slots that I love to play, a great variety of restaurants...a movie theatre, a pool, and I think they even a bowling alley! I was there for four days and didn't even have time to explore it all. What a thrill to have my favorite Duncan Donuts coffee each morning, have cocktail hour at Friday's in the evenings and sit down to a nice Prime Rib special at the nice steakhouse they have there too! This latest trip I enjoyed their 8th floor king bed room overlooking the park and musical water/light show, and I thought the rooms were spacious and reasonable.....plus when I checked out, they checked in with a casino host and were nice enough to comp me my room based on all the fun play I had during my stay. Their staff and other guests were friendly, it was clean and well maintained and truthfully, while there might be fancier places to stay in Vegas, I don't need fancy when I can have all this in one great little package!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Chuckie-n-CarCar
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting Las Vegas annually since the early 90's and for much of that staying in Strip Casino's. As the years have progressed, the Strip has become more crowded, Latino's standing on every corner not associated with a Hotel passing out escort service cards to men, women and in some cases children and driving it has become a nightmare. Casino's that were staples have gone the way of the dinosaur. New ones taller and featuring more glitter have replaced them. We used to love going up on the Stratosphere Tower for a romantic dinner and breathtaking views of the valley and strip. No more. The unfinished new Casinos and Wynn, Encore, Aria, among others have reduced the view to something the cost of making the climb is no longer worth. Like the universe the only constant in Vagas is change. Unfortunately in my eyes, This is change Vegas could do without. We stopped staying on the strip because of the headaches associated getting there much less driving it. We started staying on the Boulder Highway at Sam's Town and re-discovered what we loved about Vegas all this time. To be honest I hope all you visitors will hate it stay on the strip and allow me to revel in this gem. The food is good and the Mystic Falls park is a great place to sit and relax, We make time to enjoy this park along with the pool every time we come to Vegas. Access to the strip, downtown and LVMS are the best you can ask for and if you choose to stay here and do not rent a car they have the most complete bus schedule to get you where you want to go anywhere there is a Casino in this town. Did I mention how much you will be amazed by the room prices vs. the strip? We all make choices when we choose to spend time in Vegas. Most of us make them on what we have been told about the attractions associated with the Casino/Hotels we are planning on staying at. This is a bad call. Those attractions are available to you no matter where you stay. Off strip is cheaper and will remind you of the Vegas that is slipping into the sunset to be no more. That is why it is so popular with local's. Sam's is a self contained city that has something for families, singles, and the rest of us. The next time you book think outside of the box and rediscover why you started coming to Vegas in the first place. We have become loyal patrons of Sam's and see no reason to change that anytime in the near future. Give them a shot and you will be suprised at the hospitality and friendliness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wish It Was Better”
Reviews.Author: lilbigmac
Reviews.Content: We stayed based on a friends' recommendation but didn't enjoy as much as we hoped. The service was great but the room was lacking. The mattress was sunken on both sides like a 'W' and very uncomfortable. The sink was very slow to drain and we found out the next morning the tub barely drained at all. The A/C wouldn't go any lower than 68 degrees though it was obviously much warmer than that and would turn on and off about every minute and was very loud. The connecting door that went to the other room also had a large space under the door and when the people next door checked in at midnight and stayed awake for the next three hours, we heard every word they said. We had a rough time with one of the servers at TGIF one night who seemed to be oblivious to everything we said after we told him we don't like seafood and we had just eaten steak the night before, he continued to try and up-sell us on steak and seafood specials. Then, when our little toddler started to get fussy and sleepy we asked if we could just get a dessert to go and get out in a hurry, our waiter disappeared for at least 10 minutes. A manager finally came out to give us our dessert and we just told him we couldn't find our waiter and needed the check so we could go. I don't want to sound pessimistic. The front desk staff was very polite as well as the reservations staff when we called. We also had a great young waitress at TGIF one morning and the rest of the staff was great in the restaurant. I was also impressed by the friendly housekeepers that greeted us in the hall every time we walked past. We got a good rate for the room or else I would have been more disappointed, but I think we will try a different hotel next time we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Sam's Town Keeps Us Coming Back - Great Place to Stay/Eat/Play!”
Reviews.Author: ReflectionsByErika
Reviews.Content: Sam's Town is perfect for those who don't mind staying off-strip from the glitz and glam but still get an awesome place to stay and play at a much lower price tag. The rooms were really nice, I was surprised the first time we went there. They were clean, modern and many overlook the huge scenic atrium. The atrium is filled with trees, bridges and life-like animals that are animated. It also has restaurants, bars and a cool laser show on the waterfalls. Some have said the casino is smokey, but I've never noticed it and I've been there a few times in the past couple of years. I do like the casino, they have loads of slots spread out so you never get that stuffy feeling you do in some other casinos. The buffet is good, and so are the other restaurants. If you want quick food, they also have McDonald's, Friday's, Subway, Panda Express, Sbarro and Dunkin Donuts, etc. For other-than-gambling fun they have a bowling alley, movie theater, outdoor pool and salon. They have shuttles to/from the strip and airport and for those who forgot their toothbrush there's a Walmart Super Center across the street that you can walk to. A really fun place to stay for a lot cheaper than the strip!

Reviews.Title: “I love it here”
Reviews.Author: Coco2707
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for couple days for the first time when I turned 21! It was just a really relaxed hotel and not to busy which was nice and they even have a dunken donuts..would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Smoke and Mirrors (and Lasers)”
Reviews.Author: Virga017
Reviews.Content: This was not one of my best hotel experiences in Las Vegas. The casino is one of the smokiest that I have experienced. I had a ungraded room, which was nice, but the bed was too soft and had the low areas from years being slept on. The food choices are very mainstream (TGIF, McDonalds) and uninteresting. The laser show and animated wildlife was interesting for a few minutes. As for value, the weekday room prices are amazing, and may overcome the other faults of the property during the week, but the weekend room prices were high and then this hotel does not compete well against many other casino hotels in Las Vegas. I was at the hotel for a conference and the hotel did a great job supporting the meeting. Parking is convenient and there is a good running area nearby. But all in all, I could not recommend this casino to others.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Fern S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a couple of times and love it! The rooms are nice looking and clean. the overall hotel is great!! We love walking throught the big garden and the lazer watershow is not to be missed. We also loved that there is lots to do, movie theater, swimming, bowling and the buffet is good. We have stayed at a few other 3 star hotels in Las vegas and overall this is our favorite. I also liked that there is a free shuttle to the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Off-Strip Value”
Reviews.Author: Steavis4
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel on the famous Las Vegas Strip, complete with the traffic and crowded sidewalks, keep looking, as Sam's Town is off-strip and stands alone. However, if you are looking for a hotel that has the old-school feel of Vegas Casinos from thirty years ago, has multiple on-site entertainment options, and cost 1/2 to 2/3 less than most of the famous strip hotels, you may consider Sam's Town. My wife and I spend the President's Day weekend (2/17/12 to 2/20/12) in room #599 at Sam's Town, our second stay in the last year. We travel to Las Vegas for a combination of business and a get-away, and find Sam's to be an excellent price/value hotel and casino. THE GOOD: Our experience at Sam's has been characterized by clean rooms; clean, albeit smoky public spaces; friendly, accommodating staff from the valet to the maid service; and good dining options that range from the cheap (McDonald's), to mid-range (TGI Friday's, and a large buffet that runs from $10 to $18 depending on meal and night), and a nice steak house. There are no celebrity chefs here, but good, reasonable food in big portions. Parking is ample and easy. And while I personally do not recommend Las Vegas as a vacation destination for children, the on-site bowling alley, multi-plex movie theater, and nifty atrium with a laser and music show several times per night does give the little ones something to do...escorted by an adult of course. THE-NOT-AS GOOD: The casino shows its age, with low ceilings and a smoky atmosphere. The beds are not the super-deluxe sleep systems you find in the pricier resorts, and tend to be a bit soft for my taste. And some services, such as bell service, takes a little more time on busy weekends than at other high-end resorts. But overall, the convenience and price makes up for these few detractors. Finally, if you are driving, and want to spend time on "The Vegas Strip" without staying there, be aware most of the large Casino Resorts on the Strip have huge, free, 24-hour self-parking garages that allow you to park and walk the strip. These garages are monitored by security, and very safe. Overall, Sam's Town is a great place to stay...for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Sam's Town”
Reviews.Author: judy_c996
Reviews.Content: Stay here frequently when in Las Vegas. Like the pool and jacuzzi. Has movie theater, bowling, a lovely inside park area with waterfall and a light show. Really like Billy Bob's steak house and Willy & Josie's Mexican Restaurants. Good variety of slot machines and table games. Comfortable, clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Used to Be Good Now Just Used”
Reviews.Author: John F
Reviews.Content: After planning a family vacation, we had called and reserved rooms during the Presidents Day weekend over a month ago. Once we arrived we were told they didn't have any rooms available. After arguing with the desk clerk we were given a suite that was from the early 90s. We were told we would have to vacate the room in the morning and check back to see if they had another room somewhere else, because all the rooms were booked for the weekend. We moved to another room with lukewarm water and a bad shower head. We have stayed here many times but not again. Sams its time for a remodel both on rooms and service.

Reviews.Title: “All in one place - variety of restaurants and things to do!”
Reviews.Author: Cruzinaround63
Reviews.Content: Stayed in January of 2012. In a regular room, no in room coffee maker. Internet was not free. At least they had a hair dryer, iron & board. On a positive note, the bed was one of the most comfortable I slept in for a hotel. You have to ask them for a map of the place so you know where all the venues are. No fitness center and the pool is outdoor and was closed. I had dinner at their steak house. Don't get the prime rib special on the marque, instead get the porterhouse on the menu. It was tender and cooked perfect. Went to a convention there, meeting rooms were clean and out of the main traffic. Bowling was fun, although not used to so much cigarette smoke. They had a shuttle that went to the strip, but it stopped running around 7PM which was to early. You can get the bus that runs down to the strip and back all night. Walgreens and Wal-Mart / mall across the street. Bottom line is that I had a lot of fun. Make sure to plan your flight along with the free airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “many coffee shops there, tgi fridays, micky d s-dunkin donut-and others.”
Reviews.Author: bandanhawaii
Reviews.Content: no in room coffee-ok rooms, low price. omlets made to order by breakfast chef with 15 yrs service to visitors. good parking-safe and well patrolled. its a middle class gambling hall and favorite of the locals. overall good place to visit. and friendly-clean. on the boulder hwy. costco, starbucks wholefoods nearby. look for senior days-bogos-free stuff.

Reviews.Title: “sams town hotel”
Reviews.Author: thepartygroup
Reviews.Content: it's a great place to stay and play great food and rooms

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant place to stay for a great price.”
Reviews.Author: Almaden
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night on business but I was pleasantly surprised by what a great value this place is. The rooms are very clean and simple. There is nothing fancy in the room but its not run down either. For example, the TV is the old tube type but it works just fine. The hotel is exactly what you want if you need a clean room for cheap. I ended up with a room that overlooked the roof of the casino but if you request an interior facing room, you get to look over the huge nice looking atrium area which at night has a laser light show. The atrium area is a pleasant place to be if you want to get away from the slot machines. Check-in is easy if you can find the desk. I walked all around the casino looking for it before discovering its in the atrium where I least expected it. The have plenty of people working the desk to make check-in go quickly and everybody was friendly. The hotel would work well for families since it has a movie theater, bowling alley, swimming pool, nightly laser light show, and a restaurant that kids would like. On my next trip I will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Low-Key Hotel with lots to do.”
Reviews.Author: Chattanooga_gal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sam's Town 1/31/ - 2/3/12. My parents were also staying here and check in was a breeze and we were able to get adjoining bedrooms. I had 2 queen beds and my parents had a king. We didn't pay for a view of the Atrium, so we had a view of the top of a building. The room was a basic room with an older style TV. My bed was very comfortable & I liked the pillows. The bathroom was simple with a single sink and showed a little wear. The toilet was stained down in the bowl with what looked like cigarette ash, but the actual toilet was clean. The shower had good pressure, but if you didn't turn the shower part on immediately, the tub began to fill with water. The rooms were also a decent size. I really enjoyed the Sam's Town complex. The atrium is beautiful and the movie theater is huge and very nice. The bowling alley is huge. There are also a lot of food choices, which is nice. The casino was fine & I liked the bingo room which had free self-serve beverages. All in all, if you are looking for a decent clean room at a great price, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here. It took us approximately 20-30 minutes to get to the strip including time to walk to your car & park on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Lisa C
Reviews.Content: Good value for the price paid. Needed a place to stay for airport run. Did not want to be on strip. Served our purpose. There is no coffee shop for breakfast . We drove to another hotel to eat. The Mexican restaurant was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “You get more than what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Bob C
Reviews.Content: The saying that YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR, is not true at Sam's Town. You get much more. The rooms are not as elegant as at the Bellagio, but you pay much much less for that room which is always clean & pleasant. My wife has two brothers who live in Vegas,that we visit twice a year. We stay at Sam,s Town for the whole time we are there,which is five to six days each time.We have been going there for over fifteen years now. You never have to leave this place because they offer so much to do. Besides gambling, they have a fast food court, several sit down restaurants, & a buffet restaurant. A multi screen theater, a very large bowling alley, outdoor swimming pool & a very large atrium which is like sitting in a park, with a running stream, a coffee hut,& a bar. A very relaxing place. It's off the Strip,but who cares. They also have a free shuttle that will take you downtown.

Reviews.Title: “off the strip, off the strip prices”
Reviews.Author: LoneOak6496
Reviews.Content: My 4th or 5th time there and worth it each and every time.. How much time is really spent in the hotel room anyway? Pillows are hard, decor is dated and "used", but it's fine. Service was fine - we were graciously moved when we had neighbors who made much too much noise at 3 am. Black out curtains deal with any extra light you may not wish to have in the room. No refer or micro or free internet, but I believe all is a available for a price. Convenient choices for food, and if you have a car (recommended) then your choices are unlimited. I'll be back! Mid week was quiet and the prices was unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “WoW! Pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: RNtraveler00
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at Sam's Town Hotel and Gambling Hall because of the low rate and "off strip" location. We were on an extensive road trip and needed a place to spend the night that was safe, warm and wouldn't break the bank. Sam's was indeed a pleasant surprise. The lobby and atrium are comparable to a 5 star hotel and our room did not disappoint us either. I'm sure if the clerk upgraded us but we found ourselves in a King suite for under $30. We are not gamblers and maneuvering around the casino was interesting :-) but I'm sure appealing to those that enjoy that. It was great that we were able to have a decent meal and above average place to stay with free parking to boot.

Reviews.Title: “Hard pillows!”
Reviews.Author: praywithu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great, the beds are quite comfortable except for the fact that the pillows are not sqishy and soft, which I prefer. I called Housekeeping and they said the firm pillows were the only ones they had. We forgot our own pillows the last time we went and we won't forget them the next time!

Reviews.Title: “Restful Retreat Off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Phylthequilter
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at Sam's twice several years ago. When looking for a place to stay during the CES, I noticed that the rates at Sam's were still reasonable during the conference. We decided to book there, and we are very glad we did. The laser, light and water show was even better than we remembered, due to advances in laser technology. The coupons we received at check-in saved us even more money. We did not need to leave the hotel to have a great meal, or a fast one. Available within the hotel are: TGIFridays (we had an outstanding meal of steak and lobster there), Panda Express, Subway, Dunkin' Donuts, McD's, Billy Bob's Steakhouse, Sabbarro Italian, a very good and reasonable buffet, and a great Mexican restaurant I've forgotten the name of. We enjoyed a movie at the 16 screen theater, could have gone bowling if we hadn't been so beat by walking the CES venue. The second day we were there, we slept in then took the hotel tram to the Strip and back-we didn't have to fight the convention traffic! My only complaint was that the hotel shuttle doesn't operate until noon. When there is a convention in town, they should be running by 9 or 10 a.m. Sam's is 6 miles east of the Strip at Flamingo and the Boulder Hwy. You can't even get lost; just look for the Flamingo on the strip, turn on Flamingo Blvd., and head away from the interstate. Our room was good sized, our beds and pillows were so comfortable, and everything was clean and in good repair. They do need to upgrade to flat-screens and stop charging for wi-fi in order to compete with some of the much more expensive hotels. We could barely detect any cigarette smoke in the gambling areas, and their players club gave us more usable coupons to save us money. One was for a discount at Shepler's Western wear, which is on the second floor. We took advantage of it to buy my husband a black belt, as he had forgotten his. I got a discount off the clearance price of a nice souvenir. There was also a gift shop on the first floor with reasonable prices. One evening we went in Ruby's club and listened to the great country band. They have different bands on different evenings. We used a coupon for a 2 for 1 margarita and watched the laser, light and water show for the second time in the atrium. The beautiful atrium in the center of the hotel has trees, rocks, streams, waterfalls, forest sounds and real-looking animals that move. You can pay a little more and have a room overlooking the atrium where you could watch the show from your window. This is a great place for families too. There is an arcade, foods kids like, the movies, bowling, and the atrium with the laser show. There is also a pool, but it was too cool in January for us to try it out.

Reviews.Title: “Sam's Town is a Winner again”
Reviews.Author: JerryAttrix
Reviews.Content: 2nd time here and the service and the hotel does not disappoint. 4th floor outside view room and it was very decent size room with king bed and very comfortable at that. No noise to speak of and only minimal complaint we had was the spotlights on the roof right outside our windows which light up the higher levels of the resort casino. Great service from the registration desk agent, Marilyn, taking care of us so we received the free buffet breakfasts for 2 days of our stay. Fantastic light show at their Mystic Falls Atrium area, enjoyed thoroughly (I am easily amused anyway). Thanks again Sam's Town for a great 3 day getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Off the strip which was nice.”
Reviews.Author: SASTMMT89
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on a recommendation from a friend. When we arrived there was a problem with our reservation (they had us down for the wrong date) but the friendly person at the desk took care of it. We had two adjoining non-smoking rooms. Rooms were clean and comfortable. We ate at the buffet which had plenty to choose from but it was near closing time so some of the choices had been sitting there for awhile - desserts weren't that great but everyone found something they liked from the food choices. We let the kids bowl a few games before heading back to the room for bed. Housekeeping was knocking on the door while we were still getting everyone ready the next morning. If we had been sleeping in that would have been annnoying. As we are not gamblers my first choice would be to stay somewhere that doesn't have a casino, however the price was right - about $36 per room for a standard room - and we didn't have to leave the hotel to get food or to go bowling. Atrium and laser light show was fun to watch. We would most likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Strip, but not off the map!”
Reviews.Author: GaryD14
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our daughter's 21st birthday celebration and stayed over New Year 2011 as the prices being charged on the Strip were ridiculous. We found our adjacent rooms to be spacious, clean and comfortable and the hotel was still decked out beautifully after the Christmas holidays. In Vegas, you spend most of your time out of your hotel, so we never made full use of the range of amenities - bowling, cinema, shops, pool etc - although the atrium bar was pleasant and the $9 'all you can eat' buffet breakfast was excellent value when set against prices elsewhere. The hotel's free shuttle bus times were not ideal for us, and the local bus took too long, so we drove to the Strip where 'self-parking' was free and unlimited in all of the big name casino/hotels. The hotel's location on Boulder Highway meant that we could easliy get out of town and onto the freeways for trips to Lake Mead/Hoover Dam and the Grand Canyon (West Rim & Skywalk) for which we chose to drive. Apart from getting back to the hotel at 2.30am on New Year's Eve/Day - which eventually took 2.5 hours - the off-Strip location was never really an issue and we felt we had good value for money given the timing of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Still a Good Bargain with Some Small Caveats”
Reviews.Author: Lifetraveler1
Reviews.Content: I’ve flown to Vegas for the Consumer Electronics Show. This year, just as in the previous four, I have only seriously looked at two hotel chains. Terribles Hotel and Sams Town. Terribles is literally about 8 blocks from the convention center. But unfortunately I waited a little bit late to make reservations and their prices had jumped up. Even with the increase, their prices were still way cheaper than the hotels on the strip. I made reservations at Sams Town, when I received an email showing a discount of about $35 a day for three days. However, a fourth night that I added will be at $89. Update: With priceline I found another hotel for that 4th night at half the price. Location: From the strip you can get to Sams Town just by driving up Flaming Rd for about 5 miles until you hit Boulder Hwy. There is a strip center across the street anchored by a Walmart. I have never paid much attention to the restaurants in the area though, because I will usually catch breakfast at one of the strip hotels before boarding the shuttle to the convention center. However on Flamingo Road on the way to the strip there are several good restaurants including Bahama Breeze, Buffet Asia and more. The Property & Building: The building for Sams Town is huge and with three parking garages I still get confused as to which one is closest to my room’s side of the hotel. It can sometimes make for an uncomfortable walk at night from the garage to the building, because only certain doors to the building are open at night. Take the time to find out which garage is closest. The Room: The size of the bedroom is quite nice. You could put a couple in there and easily have space for a portable flip out type bed for a small child. The furniture is showing its age a little, with a nick here and a crack there. But it is still decent quality for a budget level hotel. The carpet looked well cared for and lighting was sufficient. I had a king size bed this time. No, it wasn't soft and plush with that mold itself to your body type bed. But it wasn't hard either. The only issue I had was the heater, which was a little noisy when I tried to sleep. Also earlier in the evening I heard the people next door, but not at the time of sleep. The hallway is well lit. Wear and tear in the room overall, well there wasn't much. The bathroom was fine and reasonably spacious I particularly look for things like rush or torn wallpaper and saw none of that. As in previous times, with other hotels on the strip running at $150 and above, and some in the outer areas running around $80 plus per night, this is a bargain and I would stay here again. Other Items: 1. They do not have free wireless. Yes, even luxury hotels don't charge you anymore. 2. I noticed for the first time that even though you get a good rate, they charge a little administrative fee of about $4.50 per day. I hadn't noticed it before, but I was a little perturbed that it wasn't mentioned. I was told when I made the reservations online that I agreed to it. Maybe! 3. Part of the agreement you sign at the time of registration, says something about them not being responsible for theft of electronics, etc. I thought that to be quite odd since the room did not have a safe. So if the staff decides to take something, I guess it won't be their fault. Hmm!

Reviews.Title: “Love it here”
Reviews.Author: JELewis53
Reviews.Content: Took our son when he turned 21, the servers, guards and techs all got to know him and were very friendly. Its our favorite place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Ok place off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Mary3019
Reviews.Content: It was ok for being of the strip. They did have a cool light and water show.

Reviews.Title: “Good bet for off strip stay”
Reviews.Author: looniest
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel numerous times over the years, as we go frequently to Las Vegas to visit family as well as using Las Vegas as a jumping off point for trips up into Utah, California or Arizona. It is one of my favorites for location (off strip, but a short enough drive to most everything) and amenities. The strip is not the only thing around, Hoover Dam, Lake Mead, Valley of Fire and Red Rock Canyon are easier to get to from this location than from the congested strip area if you do have a car and want to get out of town. The rooms here are spacious and clean, beds comfortable and linens attractive. Some of the rooms have been updated with flat screen TVs, as I noticed the last trip we were there. The convenience of a decent buffet breakfast at an attractive price right downstairs is a big plus, you will pay less here than going out to a restaurant, as the buffet includes various juices and coffee as well as most any breakfast item you might be thinking of. Join the Boyd gaming club, you get a reduction on room rates and buffet prices as well as notifications of promotions for things like free rooms (stay two nights, get one free, for example) and free breakfast on occasion, even if you don't gamble at all. Other interesting things here besides gambling are a swimming pool and hot tub, movie theater, Western clothing store and beautiful atrium with a waterfall and animated critters that will thrill a child and nightly light show that is interesting for all. As with any hotel in Las Vegas, always check up on added fees for your stay. Most casino hotels charge extra for internet, some charge resort fees that may or may not include internet. There is a 'services fee' of $4.50 at Sam's (which does include the shuttle to the strip) and also a charge for internet at Sam's but still the room rates are usually good enough that all things considered, it is one of the better bargains we find. Read the fine print at the bottom of the page when you make a reservation online, as cancellation times for full refund are often long, like 3 days in advance. Also, if you have extra people in your room, it is a $20 charge per person over 2 people UNLESS they are kids under 15 staying with parents, they are free. So, do the math and consider everything before you choose a room in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “december vacation at Sam's Town Hotel & Casino in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: pugsvirgo
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at Sam;s Town., We go every year the second week in December. The staff at Sam's Town are unbelievable. Always helpful and very friendly. The hotel is very well organized, from the front desk to housekeeping. Valet has got to be the best. No matter what you may need, its never a problem there. Friendly atmosphere and the restaurants are great. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to relax at”
Reviews.Author: Ken L
Reviews.Content: This is a lot calmer hotel than the ones on the strip. The indoor park area is nice to sit and relax. It has a nice water show and laser show at night. The bowling alley was a nice extra that you don’t find at the strip.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine”
Reviews.Author: legendtraveler
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel at the end of October for 5 nights. When we arrived they only had double rooms available and I had reserved a king 2 months in advance, but there was nothing they could do. They put us in a 4th floor outside facing room, and it was very plain jane, but it was nice and quiet, clean, and you could see the sun rise and that was lovely. On the second night they moved us to a king room facing inside, above the water fall, oh boy was this noisy, the show seemed like it ran until 11:30 p.m., also you can not see if it is day or night, rooms are very dark and depressing. Overall, the hotel employees were very nice and a lot of elderly and little kids seemed to be very happy there.

Reviews.Title: “Sam's Town Hotel and Gambling Hall”
Reviews.Author: brickly
Reviews.Content: I was given a room I requested being disabled. Check-in was pleasant and quick. Room was very clean and comfortable. Service was great through out my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Brysum
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sam's Town in a jacuzzi suite, the room was very adequate, clean and nice... the overall property is nice but starting to show just a tiny bit of her age however this should not stop anyone from visiting... the rooms are great and the service is good.... you can't beat the value for what you are getting. check out my video walkthrough of the jacuzzi suite at: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=074Fj8vDgkI

Reviews.Title: “Good family hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Fabiosuave
Reviews.Content: Affordable rooms, pretty big casino, pool is clean, the center area has a cool water fall and show for the kids. The buffet was worth the money, in all worth the start if you don't Mind staying off the strip. It is only like a 10 min drive to the strip. It feels Alot safer off the strip with my kids.

Reviews.Title: “It's good for what it is”
Reviews.Author: drshearerss
Reviews.Content: We were in Las Vegas for a horse show - not the usual reason for going, it's true. We stayed here because it was the closest hotel to the showgrounds. It turned out to be surprisingly good. It's not the strip - not glitzy, no real Vegas vibe. It's more families and older folks here. The room was clean and quiet - our bath was missing a shower curtain, and when we told the front desk it was taken care of immediately. Some others in our group found their rooms to be a little outdated - ours was not too bad. In the middle of the first night we heard a distant alarm going off for what seemed like forever. The next day, we learned it was on a lower floor, where many of our group were staying. No explanation for the hotel why this siren blared for more than 10 minutes. But overall, if I were going back for another horse show, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: red86vet
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Sam's Town many times and really like the atmosphere. Its fun to watch the water/light show that happens three times every night. Rooms are clean and quiet. I've previously used their RV park as well. Its just a short walk to the casino and is very clean. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Endlessly charming and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: ChrisJMann
Reviews.Content: When my wife and I were planning what could be our last trip to the USA for a long time, there was no doubt in our mind that it would start at Sammy's and end there, with lots of sightseeing inbetween. Why drive 8 or 9 miles from McCarran after all that flying when we could drive 2 miles up the Strip? Because at Sammy's you can kick your shoes off and feel at home from minute one - it's as simple as that. We always promise ourselves we'll go bowling, go to the movie theatre, eat at Willy & José's and swim in the pool. We always know we won't - but it doesn't matter. Most of the machines we like are there. There's a relaxed atmosphere. We like the buffet. Then of course, there's the lovely Mystic Falls which makes me moist of eye literally every time I see it. Check-in has always been easy and we have always got what we asked for. I asked for a desert view room at the start of the trip which left us overlooking the parking lot - not so great. The room we had at the end of the trip was an improvement and we could watch lunatics in the distance doing the SkyJump at the Stratosphere. You'll probably need to avoid more walking frames and electric buggies here than at other casinos and the handwash containers by the main elevators look like they belong in a hospital, but you soon get used to that. You might have to wait for longer to see a cocktail waitress too, but Sammy's has got better in that regard in the last 3-4 years. We've always had enjoyable dining experiences at T.G.I. Friday's since Sammy's got rid of the Fresh Harvest Café, but it's expensive and we still wish the funky ol' café was there for that late-night treat, sweet or savoury. I think we'll always come back here because it's great value, friendly and it's rare that you'll see us at Sammy's without a big smile on our face! It's as simple as that.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: Debra W
Reviews.Content: I go to Las Vegas every year to see my dad who is now 84 years old. I used to stay at another hotel/casino down the road but unless you're a high roller, they treat you like you are a necessary evil. I really enjoyed my stay at Sam's Town. The room was nicer than I expected and the employees could not have been nicer. The variety of restaurants was excellent (especially Billy Bob's). I took my dad to the water show and he was so thrilled. He thoroughly enjoyed it. I did too, several times. I don't think I'll ever stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Best free indoor water show”
Reviews.Author: PadreArizona
Reviews.Content: Having previously visited Downtown and the Strip, my wife and I decided to stay three nights at Sam's Town, and we are glad we did. Being at the intersection of Flamingo Road and Boulder Highway, Sam's Club is a good location for East Las Vegas sights such as Ethel M Chocolate Factory and Cactus Gardens. The Atomic Testing Museum is on Flamingo Road between Sam's Town and the Strip. The highlight of our stay was the water and laser light show in Mystic Falls Park which is inside the hotel atrium. The show lasts about ten minutes and occurs several times a day as posted. Young and old seemed to enjoy not only the lights and fountains but also the animated creatures such as a bear and a wolf that howls. This is a real park with a waterfalls and living trees and plants. Our room on the 6th floor was nice and clean. The bathroom with ceiling light and five lights over the wash area gave plenty of light. We selected a room having a view towards Downtown which was less colorful than we expected. Other rooms face the atrium. There are plenty of eating places, and we found the staff to be friendly. We'd recommend Sam's Town for those wanting to stay in a less touristy location.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for what it is”
Reviews.Author: thecookielady
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for where the beautiful people stay....this isn't it. Older crowd and locals here. But the room was nice and the place is clean and offers lots of food choices. The Mystic Falls show is typical Las Vegas cheesy but fun anyway. Paid extra for an atrium view room but you had to squeeze behind the (big comfy) easy chairs to peer down at it, no balcony or anything, so that is not worth it. All the employees we ran across were friendly and helpful, especially the front desk. Better attitude than we run into when staying on the Strip. Not a very convenient location if you are doing things on the Strip but we were there to attend a class nearby so it was fine. However, getting a taxi out there was difficult...waited nearly 20 minutes for one.

Reviews.Title: “OMG, the smoke is terrible.”
Reviews.Author: Wynoski
Reviews.Content: I understand that smoke is part of Vegas but this was terrible. 2nd night of stay it seemed like they were pumping smoke onto my room. Front desk associates were grumpy when you asked them questions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but geared toward the older crowd”
Reviews.Author: azmarko
Reviews.Content: Sam's Town has been around forever and I finally decided to stay there. I have no major complaints about it. The only thing that discouraged me about the place is that the vast majority of the clientele appeared to be 60 and above. I'm in my 50's myself so I guess I don't have much room to complain but it would be nice to see a few young people walking around. After I was at Sam's Town for two days I took a trip over to the Imperial Palace and it was like night and day. Lots of young people. Lots of energy. The Imperial Palace made Sam's Town look like an old folks home. Don't get me wrong. Sam's Town has a lot to offer. The casino floor is huge. Tons of slot machines. The buffet is above average (and cheap!). I ate at Billy Bob's Steakhouse one night and it was outstanding, if a bit pricey. My room was fine. Nice and clean. No bedbugs! It was on the small side but perfectly adequate. The bottom line is that Sam's Town is a very good place to stay and play. It's nice and casual and tends to attract the older crowd. If you're looking for a relaxed atmosphere this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “rooms average”
Reviews.Author: julesmama
Reviews.Content: We went to sam`s for the first time in our 30+ years of going to vegas and laughlin and we will probably go back if we get it comped...........Paid xtra for a view room of the atrium,the view was o.k. they put us behind the waterfall when i`m sure there were rooms available with better views.....I asked if they had coupons and he gave me some.....I was`nt empressed with check-in,although we were allowed to check in early.Security is very good you need to have a key card to get into the elevator area and there were a noticable amount of security guards on the casino floor. My husband noticed right away that the clientle was mostly senior citizens,which is o.k.(we were only there for one day)Slot club was good,we were eligible for a slot tournament and another contest and we also gambled enough to get 2 free steak dinner buffets,buffet was nothing spectacular,pretty much the same old thing. drink girls took order and never came back while we gambeled this happened twice,yes we tip $1 each.machines paid o.k. better then the strip......But hey i`ll go anywhere they give me free rooms,this room was very plain jane and the tv was old and small,bathroom larger then some but very plain.............

Reviews.Title: “Daughter's Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Brenda E
Reviews.Content: Family all stayed at Sam's town for our daughter's wedding. Willie and jose's handled the reception. everyone had a wonderful time and we would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Still the best in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: shivergirl
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Sam's Town several times over the years, but the last 3-4 years we stayed elsewhere. This year we returned to Sam's Town for 6 nights, and found it was still the best stay in Vegas. We ate at the buffet, TGIFriday's, and BIlly Bob's. All have different venue, and all are good, but Billy Bob's is just excellent. We had a car, and visited several other casinos, and one day we took the Sam's Town shuttle downtown. Our room was always cleaned top knotch, and ready for us when we returned. Everyone goes out of their way to make your stay great. That is from checkin to checkout. Be sure to see the laser show at night.

Reviews.Title: “good value, close to the strip”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller715
Reviews.Content: stayed at sams town last year when i went to las vegas for the first time. there was nothing more awesome then flying over the strip in vegas at nite when our plane was landing. to see total blackness and then as soon as you fly over the mountain u see the strip and all the casinos lit up is something that i will never forget. you have to go to las vegas at least once in ur life. cant wait to go back. sams town is close to the strip, good value for the money, clean room, good food at the buffet and restaurants. i would recommend this hotel to stay at when in vegas.

Reviews.Title: “My kind of place!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sara K
Reviews.Content: For the past thirty years I've been going to Vegas - first few years once a year, and stayed here and there. Then I found Sam's Town - - - from then on it is the only place I stay when in Vegas. For the past probally 15 years have been going twice a year and always, always stay at Sam's Town. Comps are better than any other place, plus good food, bingo, bowling, movie theatre, pool, beauty shop. Also has a shuttle service to take you on the strip or downtown and it's freel!!!! I head there every six months (I'm from MO). Well, this last trip, on the first day there I went to play bingo - when I went to the bingo hall, I was standing in line to purchase my bingo cards and one of the staff walked by me - she turned around and said, "Hello Sara - welcome back. I was amazed. Here I hadn't been there for six months and she remembered me. Went to Billy Bob's Steak House for dinner and then again the next night. Had the same waiter. He asked me if I was going to have the lamb again as I had the night before. Again, I was amazed. Staff and their attitude help make your stay a more pleasant experience and Sam's Town has the best. Check out their web site - think you will be impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Time”
Reviews.Author: Arustygal
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel especially for the price. A little far out from the action, but had a car so no problems there. View of the mtns comfortable and clean. They have free shuttle to downtown and strip

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: grayci45
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Sam's Town Hotel & Casino was wonderful and very reasonably priced. Our room was spotlessly clean (NO BED BUGS THAT WE HEAR SO MUCH ABOUT). The beds are very comfortable. The rooms have "black out" drapes that truly kept the room dark. Actually one morning it was so dark that we did not wake up until 10:00 a.m. The only suggestion we can give regarding the room is they could up-grade their bath linens. This was our first stay at Sam's Town and we will definitely return on our next trip to Las Vegas. We have been to LV many times in the past but we are tired of the crowds on The Strip. Sam's Town is easy driving to the Strip if you have a desire to go there but Sam's Town has it all plus looser slot machines. The pool area is nice and quiet and there are not a lot of kids running around and splashing in the pool. They also have a bowling alley and a large theater. We thought the bowling alley would have about 6 lanes so we were very surprised to find it had 56 lanes!! The theater has first rate movies with comfortable, stadium seating. We watched The Maid and I Don't Know How She Does It. Tuesday's are senior rates of only $3.00. Wednesday's they have free popcorn. Both are available with you B-Connect card. Upon arrival we were pleasantly greeted by Vic. We arrived at about 11:00 a.m. and he found a room for us so we could check in early. Vic was very helpful and answered all of our questions. From that moment on we realized that ALL of the Hotel's staff was very accommodating. One other staff member that I must mention is Rebecca. She brought us cocktails as we needed them. Her station was around the slot machines The Lord of the Rings. After our first drinks she remembered what we liked night after night. The restaurants we ate at had superb food and the staff were all great . At Billy Bob's Steak House we had prime-rib that was cooked just the way we ordered it. We also ate at the Sports Bar Deli for a quick, delicious lunch on two occasions. TGIF has a great breakfast for only $3.99. You certainly can not get a breakfast like that on The Strip for the same price. We ate at TGIF on several occasions and always had a wonderful meal. We did not eat in the buffet. We went to their McDonald's (in the hotel) for coffee every morning before we ventured out to the pool. Also, on the premises is a Dunkin' Donuts which had fresh donuts for us when the urge for a donut became a necessity. We definitely will return to Sam's Town on our next visit. Thanks Sam's Town for adding to the pleasure of our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place.”
Reviews.Author: Wayne C
Reviews.Content: I’ve been going to Las Vegas for 27 years for business and to visit my mother. Over the years I’ve stayed everywhere on the strip and since finding Sams Town will never stay on the strip again. The service, rooms, gaming, overall cost, and entertainment are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A don't miss place”
Reviews.Author: loisletrvlr1
Reviews.Content: This may not be the most glamorous hotel/casino, but the people are just down-to-earth friendly and are genuinely interested in where you're from as to what you do and have done in life. Don't miss the Mystic Falls Show. It is refreshing, free and so different. I have been known to watch all four daily shows. The Casino is, well, a casino. It's the friendly people that add to the enjoyment. The rooms are comfortable and well kept.

Reviews.Title: “First time in vegas”
Reviews.Author: Pierre L
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Sep 8-15th, I stayed here based on these reviews. Everything was great from check in to ckeck out. Food and atmosphere were great, poker room was fun (Charlie the regular was great, as were Paul & Jerry & Steve). Made a guy from Canada feel welcome. Coming back to vegas in Jan, will try the Orleans next. One more thing, this hotel is geared mostly towards the senior crowd. I didn't mind since I like quiet surroundings. Don't hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but Great!”
Reviews.Author: texaggiewv
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell, Sam's Town offers some nice, basic accomodations with some very nice amenities you can't find elsewhere. The rooms are on the upper end of the basic scale. They are bright and clean and always well-maintained. Nothing fancy - comfortable beds, regular TV sets (no flat screens in the standard rooms,) and the normal amenities. They work at what they are - normal hotel rooms. What makes Sam's Town one of my Vegas favorites is what's outside the rooms. The centerpiece is Mystic Falls Park - a nine-story atrium running through the center of the hotel building. Standing at one end is Mystic Falls, the site of a nightly laser/light/water show. The park is a terrific oasis during any Vegas vacation. I slip out here for coffee in the morning taking refuge in one of the many chairs along the tree-lined paths. At night, I grab a table at the Ram's Head bar to watch the water show. (The show was recently updated with new lasers and lights and several new segments beyond the original Sunset Stampede and patriotic follow-up show.) Both Willie and Jose's Mexican Restaurant and Billy Bob's Steakhouse offer great food and views of the park. I highly recommend a patio seat at Willie and Jose's to give you a great view of the show. A bowling alley and movie theatre offer other entertainment options and their pool, while small by Vegas standards, is usually uncrowded and more than adequate. The service at Sam's Town seems to get better with each trip. While it is a "locals" casino, the staff recognizes the need to cater to tourists and they go out of their way to make guests feel welcome. Employees greet you as you walk by and are quick to offer help if you appear to need it. Unlike many things in Vegas, Sam's Town seems to keep getting better with age. I can't wait for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Female, 55, Traveling Solo”
Reviews.Author: SeaBrzJo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sam's Town, LV, from Aug 17-21 this year and had such a great time. For decades, I traveled to LV at least once a year, first staying on the Strip and then later loving Downtown, but I had not been back in over a decade. I had visited ST in the past, and enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere in the casino and grounds, but I had never stayed there. The reason for this trip was a little somber -- a "celebration of life" for an elderly aunt that lived a good, long life and loved ST Bingo. Her family (my cousins) lived on that side of LV so they recommended ST as a good place to stay. I did not rent a car, but prebooked Showtime Tours LV for airport-to-hotel RT transportation for $38 total. The cars/vans were very clean, and the drivers were right on time and very friendly and informative. I will always use them if I go back to LV. I arrived at ST around 3:30 pm on Aug 17 and was a little surprised to see quite a few people in line ahead of me on a Wed afternoon. However, this area is so nice and refreshing - listening to the waterfall and people-watching - that my ten minute wait flew by. The front desk staff - that day and many visits afterward - were very friendly, helpful, and always upbeat and positive. On check-in, I received many B1G1-free coupons for many of the restaurants so that was an extra unexpected treat. I didn't have a Boyd VIP card so didn't expect any upgrades, but I was very pleased with the 9th floor room that I got. It didn't overlook the atrium, but it was very clean and upgraded (marble bathroom countertops, wide screen TV, great black out curtains, and very clean). The bed was as comfortable as my home bed and pillows were plentiful. The room was quite large and there were armchairs; the only thing that I could think of asking for is for at least one ottoman for the chairs. Petty complaint, right? :-) But my legs were really tired a couple of nights from walking this HUGE venue several times over the day. Ok, to get back on topic to my title - single women traveling SOLO - if you are are worried about coming to LV and standing out on your own - COME TO ST! From what I could tell, single, local women of all ages are the NORM at ST/LV and also the same for men. I only play Blackjack and Video Poker, but not one employee (dealer, pit boss, bartender, cocktail waitress) or even a fellow player EVER asked me if I was traveling alone. I also went to the Buffet twice (alone) and the seating host did not consider my request for a single odd and made me feel very comfortable. Both times the host or the waitress would use the time to chat with me while they were keeping an eye on their other tables. GREAT training, ST management! Understandably, I spent a lot of time away from ST while spending time with my Aunt's family, but I always was warmly welcomed back at ST. I was there for 1-1/2 days before a lot of the rest of the family got to town and shared my story with dealers and bartenders. I could not believe how many remembered that two days later when they stopped me and asked me how things had gone. Ok this is getting quite long so let me wrap this up: Restaurants: Steak House - (Zagat Awarded): Excellent, but only got a meal to go. If it was this good back at the room, I can't imagine what it was like served at the table. I am sodium-intolerant and this was one of the best steak dinners I have had. Mexican Restaurant - Interesting, and very good. Seems like an extended family runs this one, but they are very friendly. I wasn't too hungry so only ordered a taco salad takeout. The padre tried hard to talk me out of it, but I won. It was a good salad back at the room, but I'm sure their other entrees are better. Buffet - very friendly waitstaff; food choice equivalent to good cruise ships. Dunkin Donuts/Subway - So nice that they were both there! Visited them often early in the morning or late at night and staff was very friendly. Bars - only spent some time at the bar near the tables and outside next to the waterfall, but all bartenders were friendly, chatty, and interested in us. Great bartender (sorry, can't remember his name) makes his own special blend Bloody Mary's. They change with every round, but they are good. Last tips: Make sure to stop at the B Connected Player Club Desk for your free player card before you ever throw a penny into the machines. You'll get discounts all over the property and maybe some comps later. The salon at ST: OMG, how did I leave this to last?? I had a dermobrasion facial that included an hour of massage of shoulders, scalp, calves, feet and my face looked 5 years younger that night. Make sure you ask for the same person (Debbie, I think) that does THIS full dermo facial. It was the best <$100 treatment I have ever had in my life, and canceled my massage appointments. Friends and family commented on my skin once i was back home; usually a week in Vegas goes the other way with skin ;-) Boyd Bus to Downtown - took it RT. Very prompt, be there on time. Very comfortable, nice drivers. I took it to get a cheaper cab ride to the new Outlet Mall in downtown ($6 one way). The mall is great, but outdoors, so if you hit it on a record-breaking heatwave like I did (107F) it may not be the best choice for an afternoon trip. Back from shopping, hit the Fremont (casino looks exactly like it did 10 years ago), and the California. If you are not from Hawaii you may feel a little out of place at the CA, but the staff is ok. Don't eat at the restaurant there. McCarran Airport - I had a red-eye home to FL. Just note that there our lots or shops and restaurants, but on Sunday night, EVERYTHING closes at 10 PM. Not sure about the other nights. Whew - that's all I can think of right now, but if you have questions specific to anything I've covered, please post. And have fun at Sam's Town Vegas if you're going, it's a great place for the over 50 crowd.

Reviews.Title: “My first time here ( I was curious)”
Reviews.Author: luisistaz
Reviews.Content: I had neve been to Sam's Town, I've stayed at other coast properties, so I was curious. The first thing that comes to mind is the staff, everyone here is very friendly, from the front desk, the restaurants, room service and casino, I mean every one, that's was a very positive start to my stay. The first thing you notice is that there are many ( the vast majority) retired people here, so you expect it to be a fairly relaxed and quiet place, I don't know if it was because I was there on weekday, but it seemed quite tame, and I'm not saying that in a bad way, If you want to have agood time, and relax at the same time, this place is great. The atrium ( Mistic Falls), was very cool, with benches and seats all over the place, you can relax, read a book, talk with your significant other or just make new friends, the laser show is good. The room is good, smaller than the rooms at The Orleans, but it was clean, quiet, no frills, room. I have a B Conected card, so I get some promos when I play the tables and slots. I didn't play any table games this time, but I did hit the slots, and had fun. The buffet, specialy breakfast has a limited selection, it was ok. The hotel is showing a bit of his age, but it's still a good place to relax. I would recomend it!.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED it and We'll Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: Tanup
Reviews.Content: Never been to Vegas before, heard lots about the strip. Decided to take the RV and travel at our own pace. Coming in we noticed the Sam's Town billboard and took the next exit to the Travel Centre to find our bearings. We picked another RV park but they turned us out as our RV was not new than 1999. I took my mechanic husband with me and don't need a brand new machine if you know what I mean, we take care of our stuff. So the next RV park on Nellis was Sam's Town. JACKPOT! The first place didn't have anything but a pool. Sam's Town has it all! Full hookup RV, laundry, showers, office; across the parkade (watch out for the pidgeons) was the casino, but wait, once inside: Subway, Ice Cream parlour, Handbag Store, Multiple Theatres, a pool for the hotel on site, a stage and 600 seat auditorium, TGI Fridays, 2 Steakhouses, A cabaret (Roxy's), a gift store, the quaint sports bar in the middle with the mechanized animals right out of disney, with a lazer light show several times daily, saw the signs for the bowling alley, 600 seat buffet (one whole section is desserts); I never even made it to the second floor yet - next trip! Rental car picked us up from the RV office and we drove to the airport and flew over the grand canyon, hoover dam and travelled the strip at night to see what the fuss was about. When we come back again (and we will) we'll stay at Sam's Town and travel to the strip to see the shows. Thanks, Sam's Town! What a surprise you were to our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Another Good Stay..”
Reviews.Author: Phillygwm
Reviews.Content: I've often stayed at Sam's Town and I've reviewed it on here more than once. Last time, I noted that the quality had begun to slip. I'm pleased to report that they're on top of things once again. I always try to take the casino out of the equation; it's not fair to judge the hotel based on whether I was lucky or not. I will note that the casino staff (at the tables, anyway) is very friendly. I've usually stayed in a suite in recent stays and, with the exception of my last trip, it's quite nice and generally well kept. They should clean the air vents more often because they're visibly dirty but that's my only complaint. It's unfair to compare ST to the big 5 star Strip hotels because those are $400 more per night but for the price this is an excellent value. The only downside to the suites is that they overlook the atrium so it gets loud when the Mystic Falls show is running.

Reviews.Title: “SAMS TOWN NEVADA OFF THE STRIP AND HAPPY”
Reviews.Author: stcsgt
Reviews.Content: 1.Sams Town located on the Boulder Boulevard and will cost about $39 for a return from LAS Vegas Airport with Showtime, they are the only ones that service the hotel. 2.Very reasonable Rates and upgrade was offered however declined. I was on the 3rd Floor and NO VIEW but expected that for the price. 3.The hotel has no FREE WIFI but a nearby McDonalds offers free wife and only a short walk, but other than that very happy with the hotel, the staff are friendly and the rooms are clean, slight dated but never the less good value and great away from the Strip. 4. They have a FREE shuttle to downtown and strip from the rear of the building however the last bus is around 8pm so if you plan to stay save money for a taxi or learn the bus system which is located out the front of the hotel. 5. The Bowling Alley has 56 lanes and well maintained and offers 24 hour bowling if your a fanatic and a fully serviced Pro Shop, Leauge available if your a local 6. The buffet is good value and even if your not a gambler(sorry guys you never got a Dollar out of me)but get the B CONNECTED card for discounts at the buffet and the show which is FREE on thursday afternoon at 2pm very entertaining. 7. The swimming pool is located out the back and has a spa as well, little inconvenient walking thru the gambling area but they dont seem to care, Towels provided. 8. 18 Cinema Complex with all the trimmings and FREE popcorn on Wednesday with the B CONNECT CARD 9 Besides the buffet there are a number of other Restaurants including a nice mexican and Steak Place and if your with children there is a McDonalds,Panda express,Dunkin Donuts, TGIF and Subway so your catered for. 10 All around this is not PARTY TOWN but thats a great thing and the pleasant atmosphere and entertainment at the bar and remember the Mystic falls show makes for a nice change at this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing stay-cation”
Reviews.Author: Tutuwahinelv
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here a couple of weeks ago. Arrived about 2p on a Sunday afternoon. Check in was quick and efficient. Had requested a park-view room, but would have probably enjoyed a ‘valley’ view much more. The Mystic Falls was down for repairs, so there was really nothing to view. I’d have enjoyed seeing the city lights, and the Strip off in the distance. I would not pay extra for a ‘park-view’, but that’s just my opinion. There room was clean. It is showing its age a bit, and could probably stand some updating. The flat screen tv is secured to the wall, and doesn’t tilt or pivet at all, which makes for akward viewing from the second bed or the chair near the window. Had Breakfast in the buffet. It was mediocre at best. Sams’s Town used to have a wonderful breakfast buffet, but I wouldn’t go out of my way to eat there anymore. The choices were the minimum, eggs, biscuits, gravy, bacon (not crispy at all) sausage, toast or bagels, danish. They do have an omelet station, again with limited options. The pool seems a little on the small side compared to some of the bigger resorts, but was more than adequate. It is however in a strange corner of the property, and once the sun heads into the mid afternoon, its completely in the shade. So if you want some sun, go early. Overall the service was wonderful. This is a great spot away from the craziness that is the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “I had high hopes for this place - had fun, but won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: ccolt
Reviews.Content: Sam's Town is about 6 miles or so from the strip and we chose to stay there because it seemed like most hotels we called on the strip charged for kids, and we have four of them. The staff was very friendly and the room rates were affordable. First impression when I walked in was it was not exactly the cleanest hotel and it had a pretty strong smell of cigarette smoke, which (to me) made it feel all the dirtier. Because of this I actually upgraded our suite to one of their biggest rooms thinking it was more expensive so it would be better kept. However, it didn’t seem to help. The room was still not very clean, one of the phones didn’t work at all and had something sticky (not that I want to know) on it. In all fairness the room was very big and you can tell this hotel was something else in its heyday. Our kids loved the room and loved being able to look out their window at the water/laser show. We all like swimming and this hotel is not laid out very well if you want to get to the pool, especially with little kids. It was a long walk, but through the casinos! So it was a little awkward to be traipsing through the hotel in your swimming close in the middle of the casino. We tried to eat a couple times in the hotel at their restaurants but evidently nobody cares to clean off any of the tables, so both times we ended up having to clean off our own tables despite the fact we seemed to be some of the only people in the restaurants. My wife’s not-so-favorite part was the fact that later in the evening (around 7pm or so) it felt like we were in a retirement home with the type of people walking around. Overall, we won’t be staying at Sam’s Town again, even though our kids loved it and had fun watching out their window. The reasons I won’t be staying there again is 1) it was not very clean, 2) the floor plan (if you are a swimming family) is not very well thought out, and 3) we have younger kids and didn’t feel it was appropriate or a good idea to have to drag them through cigarette smoke and a bunch of strangers in the casinos just to do anything (i.e. swimming, bowling, eating, etc…). Next time we will definitely be staying somewhere else. If I would have known I can upload pictures as part of the review, I would have taken a lot of them! Lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “A world unto its own, away from the strip.”
Reviews.Author: Gizmostarr
Reviews.Content: Sam's Town gave us a great room at a great rate. The center "wilderness" space is a relaxing place to stroll and get away from the lights and action. And the staff, including dealers, are pleasant and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “My wife and I had a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Kunoman
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at Sams as we were only staying for one night and that happened to be on a Sat. and I didn't want to spend hundreds of dollars for a $50 room on the strip.. We were a bit leary about what to expect but were absoluty pleasantly surprised.. we had a very nice time.. You see an older crowd here which was just fine for me.. The hotel and casino were very clean and didn't have an overpowering smell of cigarette smoke. The room showed a bit of its age but was expected. You can't expect a place to look brand new when it has hundreds of people going thru it every day.
