My hat is off to the ownership and management for the hard work they do to provide a pleasant experience.. Will be back again and will recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Candacewp
Reviews.Content: met up with high school friends for a 60th birthday - Sam's Town was actually a very good place to stay once I found Wizard of Oz, Star Trek and Lord of the Rings slots. Fridays is a good addition but the steak house and mexican food restaurants were very pricey. The rooms were clean with nice bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: jbg79
Reviews.Content: We have a host, Kathy Gant, who takes exceptional care of us. All of the people who work at Sam's Town remember us and have become friends over the past 15 years. It is like a fun home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this place!”
Reviews.Author: LindaLosAngelesCA
Reviews.Content: Sam's is our favorite budget friendly hotel in Vegas. We go about 5 times a year, and after a few stays they comp you rooms with their club cards! Doesn't get better than that!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home for this cowboy family...”
Reviews.Author: ssdmom
Reviews.Content: Loved the western atmosphere. If you're traveling with kids, you'll love Sam's Town. The staff was super friendly and helpful. The hotel was right out of "Bonanza!" Clean, comfortable, extremely reasonably priced, and a treat to be off of the strip! Great fun at the pool and on site restaurants. The falls were refreshing to sit by after being out in the Vegas heat all day. Very much looking forward to going back. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the traveler that dosent mind all the frills”
Reviews.Author: nmfallguy
Reviews.Content: The only thing I have to say is Make sure your not in a hurry to check in.The front desk needs alot of help...When I stayed here in June the pool was out of order, They said I could go to the RV park if I wanted to swim.Also the Light show in the court yard was down,I asked some of the other guests what they thought ,most didnt even know about the show.Food is OK but not one Id make a special trip for.The Steak House prices have gone up and the service has gone down.The room was clean,the bed was comfortable,all in all not a bad place to stay for the money just make sure you book in advance to get the best rate............

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Wessels072482
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very pleasant to stay, atmosphere was wonderful very peaceful but yet exciting, would go the Vegas Strip but was always so nice to get back to Sam's Town to relex and gamble some more without the Hussle and Bussle. Slot actually paid out bigger amounts than the strip. Everything you need is right their in the Hotel Complex - movie theatre, bowling, inside park (awesome) restaraunts. pool

Reviews.Title: “First time there and we will return”
Reviews.Author: chg2it
Reviews.Content: The Hotel staff was very helpful and freindly. We were there for 5 nights. There is a shuttle to the strip and one to downtown. Very convenient. Only problem with the shuttles is that they do not run past 9:00 pm. Better is they ran until 1:00 am. The food was good. The dealers at the tables were outgoing and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Last Year”
Reviews.Author: TxJenny
Reviews.Content: Last year we stayed at Sam's Town and my husband said he would never go back. He didn't like the atmosphere and didn't fit in well with the clientele of more mature people. It was tired looking and depressing and the slots didn't pay at all. However, since we were offered three free nights in July, we decided to go again. I'm not sure what they have done over the last year, but it was greatly improved. The crowd was lively and fun, and the slots paid on occasion. TGI Friday's is a very good addition. The previous cafe was definitely lacking. We didn't eat at the buffet. All in all, a much better experience.

Reviews.Title: “A week at Sam's Town”
Reviews.Author: MGD67
Reviews.Content: This was a family vacation to see Las Vegas for the first time ever. I used third party booking and we got a real steal of a deal at Sam's Town for 4 nights. Since we were on a budget, we drove from our hometown in Northern California so we were not worried about being off the strip. Our non smoking room was spacious, light and clean and I assume this was true for all other rooms as well since we had two queen beds-nothing fancy. Though there is a free shuttle to the strip, the drop off and pick up location is on the opposite end of where some of the more well known casinos are AND the last shuttle back to Sam's Town is at 8:00 pm. We took the shuttle twice before we figured out that it was easier to do what we wanted to do using our own car. But be aware that if you stay here it's a good 15 minute ride to get to the strip and park. We used the pool every day. It's nothing fancy but clean and well kept and they provide beach towels at the pool free of charge. There are plenty of fast food options at Sam's Town but even the McDonalds there was over priced. Save some money and drive just two blocks to Denny's or a little farther for a "regular" McDonalds. My one complaint would be that the laser light show or "Sunset Stampede" in the atrium of the hotel was not working due to maintenance and our son was really looking forward to it so he was very dissapointed. I would go back again as it was overall a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Super-Fun Resort, Great Prices, Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: dhoag123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sam's Town Las Vegas for 4 nights with my 13 year old son. We had alot of fun! The hotel has an on-site multi-screen theatre and a 50-lane bowling alley. The hotel was very clean and there was always bowling available. The prices were very reasonable. The staff was very friendly (except in the bowling alley where they're a bit grumpy and disinterested). There's a TGI Friday's, Dunkin' Donuts, Subway, McDonalds, Panda Express & a pizza place on-site also. And a video arcade. We'll defintely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “ANOTHER OF BOYD'S COMFY & COZY OFF-THE-STRIP RETREAT”
Reviews.Author: Chacha2u
Reviews.Content: If you're strictly looking to stay in Vegas for some comfortable & relaxing down time without the crowds, glamour and glitz of the Strip or away from the Downtown Fremont Experience, I suggest you head over to Sam's Town. It's location is about an 18 minute drive away from the Vegas Car rental center using some of the back streets instead of the highway. I've stayed at the Boyd's Sam's Town on more than one occasion in the past, and very much enjoyed my stay during the Christmas & New Years Holiday season. This hotel is a favorite among the locals in Vegas with a more homey feel to it. During Rodeo season, this place can fill up fast with those good ole' cowboys and cowgirls dressed to the nine's in boots, 10-gallon hats etc., The rooms are are quite similar to the Boyd's Main Street Hotel & Casino in decor, yet very cozy, comfortable, spacious and clean. Some rooms are situated surrounding an enclosed Mystic Garden area when looking out of the inside window and other rooms across the hallway will offer a view of the outside surrounding area of the Sam's Town property. You'll find very friendly and professional staff here who are willing to take the extra step to make your stay enjoyable and pleasant by all means. There are a variety of eating places scattered throughout the hotel ensuring that you won't have to walk from one end to the other end. You'll find an open area soup & sandwich deli overlooking the sports book area, a Mexican restaurant, a steak house, and on another end of the hotel, a little food court that offers some fast food take outs, besides a pretty good and tasty buffet which most people seem to settle for. Be sure to sign up for a Boyd's B-Connected card that can be used at all Boyd properties. A shuttle is offered to the Downtown Boyd properties such as the Main Street Station Hotel & Casino,, Fremont Hotel and California Hotel. Points can be used for meals at all these properties, although it is still very reasonable in price. There are a variety of table games, slots, Bingo on the 2nd floor etc., and areas which are smoking and non-smoking too. My favorite table game there is the Pai Gow table and the craps table where I always have a lot of fun playing due to meeting a lot of nice people who frequent this hotel. If you want to venture out just for a change but, not have to travel to far, the Cannery Hotel & Casino is about a 2 minute drive down the street. You do have a Walmart directly across the street from Sam's Town if you need to pick anything up last minute that you may have forgotten to pack. There is also a little convenience store within the hotel, and a beauty shop that offers last minute needs for the women that do hair and nails by appointment. There's nothing frilly about this place, and its as real as one can get to having a chance to meet some beautiful and real local people in the area, along with some very friendly and professional staff who will make your Sam's Town experience not only enjoyable, but just as memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it and well worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Ronniecesmom
Reviews.Content: My partner and I go to Vegas every year. We have stayed on the Strip several times and we have used our timeshare other times. Normally we are flexible when we travel but we weren't this time because it was a family function. I never heard of Sam's Town until I googled for accommodations. After reading the reviews, I said we will chance it. We rent cars when we go so getting around wasn't an issue. Long story short, we were very pleased with the property. After flight delays and lost luggage we arrived at 1 AM (PST) and the Receptionist treated us as if it were 1 in the afternoon. The room was clean and suitable. We paid $34 a night which included a $4 fee per night. It wasn't a problem because I read the fine print when I booked the reservation. The restaurants, movies, casino were perfect for us. We didn't go in the pool. Over all we will be staying there again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Great price great room”
Reviews.Author: clippermama
Reviews.Content: Loved it. Did not think I would staying off the strip but it was nice not a lot of people. Clean and great price

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: rdwilko
Reviews.Content: We stayed at sam's town for 14nts and we loved it.the room was fantastic it had a coffee maker,fridge and 2 reclining chairs.the staff are so friendly and helpful,the hotel has got loads of aminities that you never need to go out.with the money we saved coming to sam's town we could hire a car so getting to the strip was easy but we also could explore outside of Vegas. We loved every minute at sam's town and would recommend it we have stayed on the strip before and the rooms are not as good, the hotels are to noisy and most importantly to dear for what you get.would we go back to sam's town? YES please.

Reviews.Title: “Homey”
Reviews.Author: wildkate
Reviews.Content: I would recommend Sam's Town to any one of any age. Excellent staff that goes out of the way for information of the gratuities that is offered and things to do. Yes it is off the strip of the hub bub. Quiet is the norm their. You can relax in the park with a book or just listen to the birds sing. Many eating establishments in , what ever your taste buds require at a moments notice.And the machines are well kept up, you won't find out of order on these machines like at some casinos. The pit staff will show you how to play if in doubt about a game of chance. All over I have been to Sam's Town 5 times in two years and this is the only place I stay in play. Don't care for the strip to gamble I will always prefer Sam's to all others. I have stayed other places in Vegas years ago and above all I recommend Sam's all the way to stay and play and to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Check some of the other Casinos in the area for Food. The Buffet is not up to par.”
Reviews.Author: JimmyKaratekid
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy this hotel. I always get an upgraded room. They tend to be better, larger and in a better location , and for a few dollars more it is well worth it. There is only one problem and it seems that the Hotel Management will not do anything about it. And that is the last Shuttle of the day to Downtown Las Vegas. Since it does not get dark until well after 8PM, the last shuttle goes from Sams Town to Downtown at 8:15 PM. It arrives at the El Cortez Hotel at 8:15-8:20. Then the shuttle departs at approx, 9PM. I saw half of the people that arrived on the bus miss it. They had to take a taxi at a cost of 20-30 Dollars. I mentioned it to the Hotel Management only to get a shrug and was told that this has been an ongoing problem for a long time but the Hotel will not do anything about it. It is a shame because it is such a great hotel and this small thing could be rectafied.

Reviews.Title: “Great place! Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Darrad79
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the Paul McCartney concert at the MGM and had three free nights at Sam's Town. We had no idea what kind of place this was because our free nights came from another Boyd Gaming Casino in Louisiana. As we walked in we were pleasantly surprised at how fresh and clean and large the place was! The staff was extra friendly! The area in the middle of the hotel is really refreshing with the trees and waterfall. There's a bar right by the "Mystic Falls" (they call it) and we hung out there quite a bit. The scenery is really nice with the meandering walk way. Especially at night when its all lit up! Our room was big and very clean and it overlooked the Mystic Falls and our favorite bar. There was a huge window outside our elevator that overlooked a beautiful mountain. We didn't really care for the Firelight Buffett...to us it was about like a Golden Corral or something similar. And since the steak resturaunt closed so early we always wound up eating at Friday's, which turned out to be pretty good anyway. The casino is full of every kind of machine you could ever want. And I can't forget about the bar over by the Race book. Fantastic bartenders!! Loved those guys! They kept us laughing the whole time we were there. It was an unforgettable stay in Vegas! Sam's Town's free shuttle took us to the strip and the concert was incredible! To sum it all up....we did not want to come home !! :)

Reviews.Title: “Will be back...the price is right!”
Reviews.Author: lizstas
Reviews.Content: Sam's Town has everything from gambling to restaurants, movie theaters, bars, and even a laser light show! The rooms are clean but my main complaint would be they are so very dark...and the beds are so low to the floor--not the best but we stayed free but when paying you are still under $50 a night. The buffet is reasonably priced for a change and the food is ok. The staff throughout the property are extremely nice. I would highly recommend for the budge conscious and for those that would like to win a little...the machines here are definitely nicer than what we've experienced on the Strip...to management I'd say..brighter light bulbs please!

Reviews.Title: “Always great”
Reviews.Author: elvis032
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at Sams since the hotel opened in 1979, and so this little tribute to all. Through 32 years of slots and beers, of money won and lost . The friends we met at good old Sams, are what we value most . So as bid our fond adieu, we want to tell you true. That special place here in our hearts, is kept for all of you. A special thanks to Rebecca Riemer Ball, Sam-E Flannery, and of course to the Don Rickles of Sams Town now retired , Jerry Flannery, and to all of the other great people at Sams. Chuck and Joan Peterson

Reviews.Title: “LAWAYS A COMFORTABLEPLACE WATER SHOW IS SPECATULAR”
Reviews.Author: stersource
Reviews.Content: We've been here several times Typical Sam Boyd HOSPITALITY CLEAN AND COMFORTABLE. really friendly and lots of actiivties. Close to other casinos but we've been going since 1992>> 4 years after Pawn Stars opened!!!

Reviews.Title: “I would rather sleep in a tent”
Reviews.Author: TheAmericanTraveller
Reviews.Content: It was horrible! Felt as though the matters was stuffed with newspaper! Cable was fuzzy and tv was probably 30 years old. I slept horribly. Buffet was way to salty. I would rather eat at mcdonalds. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: CaptainBill2010
Reviews.Content: Over the years I've stayed at Sams Town over 30 times and have always enjoyed my visits. As a Boyd casino, they have one of the best loyalty programs in the gaming industry. They are also very generous with comps and free rooms on return visits. They have an excellent selection of slot and video poker machines and cater to the local crowd with better pay-offs. If you are lucky enough to get invited to one of their tournaments, you are in for a treat. They have a lot of fun putting them on, so you do too. The rooms are midlevel and I always ask for one the higher floors. They have an excellent steak house, a great mexican restaurant and a so so buffet.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: ChgotoCancun
Reviews.Content: Actually, Sam's Club is more like 3.,5 stars. I really liked the place. It only cost about $23 a night (getaroom.com). The room was a nice sized room (not too big or too small). Two comfy chairs, king sized bed (which was comfy, tho the pillows were fairly small), a desk and chair. Lighting was good. The bathroom was big with a counter large enough for any accessory (hair, makeup, toiletries). The shower had strong, hot water with a bowed shower curtain. They wanted to charge us $15 a night to overlook the waterfall/park area. We said no, so our view was the roof with a huge light shining in our room (the curtains did a sufficient job blocking it so we could sleep). What we really didn't like was that it had no mini fridge or coffee maker, but for the price...The TV was tiny (the remote control worked well). Also, we had an adjoining room and was woken up each morning by people next door getting ready to leave and meeting up with others right in front of the adjoining room and they were loud! Not fun. The crowd was a bit ghetto and older. However, some of the older couples were hand in hand or arm and arm...so cute. The Roxy lounge had a jazz esemble and people were dancing. I really do not like that type of music and would never engage, but the people who did looked like they were having so much fun. We ate at Panda Express and McDonalds (McDonalds charged .75 for a refill of pop, which I never heard of before). Panda Express was really good. The Shuttle service was awesome. We went to the strip, back to Sams and then out to downtown all in one day. It was great. There was a high amount of security, so many that we thought "Is this place really NOT that safe??" The Java Coffee Hut was VERY expensive, for no real reason. The Shuttle service (showtime) to the airport cost $22 per person just because it's 10 minutes (that's how long it took to get to the airport) from Sams Town. The price was 5 star! The room was comfortable, but no view, no extras, tiny TV. High security (does Sams Town need that much security?), lower class clientel, but cute older couples. Awesome shuttle. High priced coffee, good fast food (if you are into fast food). Buffets were just adequate (but cheap). We would go again, because of the shuttle service and their cheap rates. Right across the street from Walmart, some other fast food and discount shopping. I heard that Sams Town was near no where, not true. There is some eating and shopping areas right across the street. There is a cute pool and a hot tub. I think it's opened to at least 10PM.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE OF HIDDEN FRONT DESK FEES”
Reviews.Author: smart_cookie_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night April5,2011. Paid for everything upfront with a major charge card.Received the bill and paid for it in full.Next billing cycle was an additional charge of $4.50 for a front desk fee.Called for an explanation and was told this was a front desk fee,with no further explanation.Since when do hotels charge you for checking in or whatever mysterious reason behind it ? Always stayed there but never again nor will any of my family or friends. Hope the hotel feels $4.50 is worth thousands of dollars in future revenue !

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service, great fun, had a ball”
Reviews.Author: prideworks
Reviews.Content: Sam's Town was excellent. From check-in to check-out, every member of the staff made of point of asking if I needed anything. The casino was great, I won a little, lost a little, but learned a lot and had a great time. The dealers and pit boss are friendly and go out of their way to be helpful if you're a novice. You can stop any member of the staff and ask a question; if they don't know the answer they'll direct you to someone who does. The front desk personnel were awesome, even when they were slammed-busy. The buffett was very good with a good variety. Buffett personnel were friendly and helpful. The slot/floor attendents checked often to see if you needed a beverage. The rooms were clean and bright. Cleaning staff did an excellent job. I highly recommend Sam's Town.

Reviews.Title: “Suite was Sweet”
Reviews.Author: KathyZ317
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas on vacation and my husband surprised me with a suite. It was very very nice and I didn't think the price was out of line. The maid service was exceptional. We enjoyed the extra room and especially the coffee pot. We had a room overlooking the atrium which was very enjoyable. Don't eat the breakfast buffet. It was awful. I don't care if it was cheap....Ick.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay, Clean Comfortable Rooms, Courteous Staff”
Reviews.Author: SKLWest
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night on our way to CA. Usually we stay on the Strip but opted for a less busy experience than the Strip. We were very surprised and delighted by our experience at Sam's Town. It's 8 miles to the Strip and the hotel provides a large coach bus to guests to/from the Strip and Fremont St, which we used. We have never stayed here but the past reviews were good. Ideal for families since it is very clean, the rooms are updated and spacious, bathrooms were clean, functional, and accommodating and it has a family friendly atmosphere, even though it is a casino hotel. Can't say enough about how friendly the staff was--front desk, maids, buffet hostesses, waitresses. Definitely will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at a great pri ce”
Reviews.Author: pasquale12345
Reviews.Content: good food good rooms at a price you can afford nice people and great service. fair gaming no brainless naked dealers good action

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for an outstanding sports book, terrific table games, and a great selection of slots-Sam's Town is it”
Reviews.Author: raelynn219
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled with a widowed friend and had requested adjoining rooms. We arrived on Sunday evening, the day the NASCAR event concluded, and adjoining rooms were not available. We were assured we would be moved early the following day, and true to their word we were in adjoining rooms at 11 am on Monday. This was an example of the outstanding service we received during our 5 days stay. We love the friendly atmosphere, helpful staff, great food selection, and lovely rooms. We will always stay at Sam's Town.

Reviews.Title: “great deal if you get a room for $40 or less”
Reviews.Author: Goodfoot0227
Reviews.Content: We haved stayed here multiple times over the past two years. The rooms have always been clean, but the place is showing it's age. The mattress is firm, which we want. Noticed the bar soap is really cheesy now, small things like that add up to make me less happy here. Because it is located on the Boulder Highway, you get your share of drug dealers and prostitutes on the highway, but I have never felt unsafe at Sam's or travelling around the neighborshood or driving in this area. Like any vacation area, you always need to be aware of your surroundings. This would be true even at the best hotels on the strip. The buffet is barely OK, if you know what to pick from it. Billy Bob's and the Mexican restaurants are good to very good. Skip TGIF Fridays, awful and overpriced. Sam's should bring back their own coffee shop. The machines are pretty darn tight, they were much looser years ago. The staff has always been terrific, esp. the front desk staff and housekeeping. If you can get a room for under $40 or so, think this is the place to stay if you don't mind driving, or taking the Sam's shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling the age”
Reviews.Author: DesertLuvr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sam's Town, LV again in February 2011. It's nice to see people there again. A few things that are noticeable: Room was clean as expected. No shampoo in the room and nice bar of soap missing. Slots/video poker are very, very tight. There is a distinct lack of jackpot sounds in the casino. I'd guess payout has gone down to the 70-80% range but the people keep putting their money in. Buffet was awful; plain, mediocre offerings and now very high priced at >$10 for breakfast; go elsewhere. Maintenance is suffering; elevator lights don't work on some floors, ice machines not working on some floors. While this is still a nice enough place, it has made my list of "do not return" properties in Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: PlySoccerMom
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean. Large gambling area. Parking was close. It's not on the strip but why pay the price to stay on strip. Lots of choices for meals. Even watched a movie without leaving the property. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast on the weekend but was disappointed in the difference on Monday. Not nearly the selection, most of the buffet was closed off. It was a little disappointing, however, to hear the couple in the room next to us talking on the phone at 7:00 in the morning! Better sound proofing would be nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel/casino for children or even couples.”
Reviews.Author: iansgal51510
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hotel/Casino twice now for a pageant I was attending with my daughter. Because of the reason we were there we did not use any of the casino machines or tables but I can review the rest of the hotel for families who may be visiting and give what I think would be cool for couples. First off, if it were just my husband and I this would be a really cute hotel to stay at. It is away from the strip so if you want to enjoy the strip and have any adult cocktails while you are on the strip dont stay here. It is about 20 minutes away and you dont want to drive there after a night out but if you are looking for a fun casino in Vegas away from the strip this is a really good one. The area is very shady though so stay in the casino. The patrons are not low quality. It does not appear that people who live in the area come into the casnio at all and I always forget the area it is in isnt the best when we stay here. They have a good amount of machines and tables and I suspect this place is a locals favorite. Now for things I can really review on based on my previous stays: The check in staff is very very nice and friendly. They are very helpful and always have a smile on thier face. The rooms are nice and comfortable and a very good size. Comfortable beds and a nice tv. Ask for a room over looking the atrium! The atrium is in the center of the hotel and has wild stuffed animals that actually put on a water show three times a night. You can watch the show from your room if you have an atrium view which is just wonderful! The hotel is very clean and bright. It makes you feel at home. They only have one gift shop but it has a good variety of gifts. There is a TGI Fridays (food is ok there), Dunkin Doughnuts, Movie Theatre, Aracade for the kids with redemption center, Ice Cream store, Subway and another finer dining reastaurant but I can't remember the name since we didnt eat there. I really do recommend this hotel for famillies who want to see the sights but not pay the strip prices or for a couple looking for a non-strip related get away!

Reviews.Title: “Nice amenities. Terrible beds.”
Reviews.Author: R1lissa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is off strip, but just a few minutes away. There is a Wal-Mart across the street and a Walgreens just down on the corner. Of course, the casino area and other open areas reek of cigarette smoke, but the rooms did not, so that was a plus. The beds are terrible. Hard mattresses, thin sheets and blanket, tiny pillows. The worst hotel bed I have ever slept in. The TGIFridays was WAY over priced. The buffet was a good deal for the money. There are plenty of dining choices inside the hotel, including a Dunkin Donuts, McDonalds, Sbarro Pizza, Subway, ice cream shop, Mexican restaurant, and steak restaurant. The lobby is very pretty, with running streams and a waterfall. There is a light/water show several times in the evening. If you can, get a room looking into the lobby. There is a charge for the Wi-Fi. Get with the times Sam's Town! Wi-Fi should be free. There are much better hotels in Vegas, but you will pay a much bigger bill if you choose to go to one of them.

Reviews.Title: “HARD TO BEAT”
Reviews.Author: Kutztown_Pa_Relaxed
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Sams Town several times and we enjoyed it very . much.They have clean rooms, good food,(Billy Bobs Steak House was excellent) and a nice sized casino. The shuttle service to the strip and downtown is definetly a big plus.We will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “This Place Exceeds the Word Value!!”
Reviews.Author: Lifetraveler1
Reviews.Content: I knew that I was coming to the 2011 CES Convention in Vegas. So I started looking for discount airfares back in September. Unfortunately, I didn’t feel the good deals that I did for 2010 and I kept procrastinating. While I was concentrating on the airfares, the hotel rates were creeping up too. Couldn’t find anything reasonable near the strip, so I looked at two standby hotels I had used before. The hotels were Terribles Resort and Sam’s Town. Although much further away from the strip, I picked Sam’s Town because it was about $30 cheaper than the other one. A strip hotel would have been more than $200 for just ONE night. I picked the most basic room, but was given an upgrade when I got here to a premium room. With two nights at $90 plus tax, I was very pleased at what I saw. I took some photos before messing up the room. Location: Sam’s Town as I indicated is a good seven miles from the strip. There is absolutely nothing to do, but gamble and bowl at Sams Town. But it is a straight shot from the Strip via Flamingo Rd. The area around the hotel is business and residential. It was very quiet and I felt quite safe getting out of my car after midnight. A security officer though was present when I walked in. Lobby: The interior of the lobby has that cowboy-gold mining kind of motif. But the materials are good and nothing looks shabby. They also have an atrium area that is a pleasant place to have a beverage. Room: King size bed and the furnishing were not upscale, but in no way did they look worn and deteriorated. In fact, they looked quite well maintained. The carpet is industrial type but a nice pattern and clean with no apparent wear. The room is also relatively large and it is very quiet with decent lighting by lamps. Large LCD tv on the wall, a mini refrigerator (which I’ve learned never to touch). It has a reasonable amount of closet space and a nice bathroom. Surroundings: I arrived late by plane, so I didn’t take much time to see what stores and services were in the area. There is a Wal-Mart across the street and several places to eat as you go down Flamingo towards the strip. Here are photos of the room just before I crashed. The place is a super value if you don't mind being away from the strip. The savings made it easy to afford a car rental for about $60 to get where I had to go. Oh, no free wifi, but at these prices who cares!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay off the strip”
Reviews.Author: freberd
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at sams town for christmas. We had be connected card and paid only $30 a night for room Love the atrium to relax and enjoyed the christmas show. Room had atrium view. Next time will book room not on atrium side so I don't wake up to christmas music at 8 am. It isn't super loud but loud enough if you went to bed late Room clean and comfortable. I like that they don't use bedspreads. Because nobody washes them weekly at hotels

Reviews.Title: “pick pocket problem”
Reviews.Author: junofire
Reviews.Content: day one got hit on by a working girl at the bar day two a pick pocket got my wallet, while playing slots, cameras saw nothing day four wife purse was picked very poor security wont go there again

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but not much to do.”
Reviews.Author: KrystalLH
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a bowling alley, movie theater, a few restaurants, and their big waterfall attraction. It's off the strip and the shuttles only run to freemont and Harrah's, and the last one back is around ten at night. Traffic can get pretty bad if you have to keep driving to the strip and back. There's not much around this hotel, so I hope you like to gamble if you stay here. They do clean the rooms quite well, however. No free internet though, and I believe the costs are about $8 per hour, $30 for three days, and $50 a week. Not worth it! There are plenty of hotels out there with free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: NAMSanAntonio
Reviews.Content: We were passing through Las Vegas on our way to Utah & my parents have always told me to try Sam's. Well we stayed Sun Oct 24th & the room was only $30!! Couldn't beat it. The casino is quiet & the rooms are comfortable. I'd suggest this hotel especially if you're trying to get away from the strip & the choas or even if you're just passing through Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Too far off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: txfrekles
Reviews.Content: We attended a reunion here so really didn't have a choice, however, the rates were good for mid-week stay. Nothing fancy at all. Taxi from airport was $35 one way [w/tip] but only $25 return trip [w/tip]? The catered dinner was good and presented nicely in one of the banquet rooms. Gambling was a bust here- we took the free shuttle downtown then city bus to the strip where we won some jackpots. Overall, it was okay for the short time we were there. I prefer the strip. Rooms were clean - bed was hard - pillows were like rocks.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel- Good Price”
Reviews.Author: vacaymich
Reviews.Content: I stood here while visiting las vegas. It was a good room at a very good price. Not nothing fancy- but was good enough for me- since I didn't stay a whole lot of time in it anyways. I love the mystic falls show. I also liked that it had Dunkin Donuts there.

Reviews.Title: “Still a good value!”
Reviews.Author: Franr123
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Sam's Town several times. We appreciate the quiet location away from the strip. If you use their gambling card, you can get some very good deals on rooms. We paid about $67 for Sat. night and Sun. was free. For that price we had a very nice 2 queen room with a view of the mountains. They have a free shuttle that will take you to the strip or to downtown (Fremont St) but we didn't use it this trip. This was just a short trip for us, and we elected to just stay in this hotel. Sam's Town has almost everything anyone could want. Low end restaurants like at a food court and higher end like a steak house and others between like TGIFridays, etc. Bowling alley, bingo hall, and movie theatre are there also. The park like setting is lovely and is like being outdoors exept climate controlled.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK to get sick at Sam's Town”
Reviews.Author: lin_bea
Reviews.Content: In 2008 there was a review stating that it wasn't a good idea to get sick at Sam's Town, because of an alleged lack of support and assistance from the hotel staff. I am pleased to report a quite different experince last week. On our second night my friend came down with severe abdominal cramps and bleeding. When I notified the front desk, security personnel were there within two minutes. After evaluating the situation, they made an immediate call for emergency support, which arrived within five minutes, after which it was determined that my friend should be transported to ER at a nearby hospital. She was administered several tests, after which she was discharged from ER. Sam's Town security not only transported us back to the hotel, but also later drove me to a nearby pharmacy to pick up her needed mediations. Fortunately, she was suffficiently recovered the next day to be able to play and even win a jackpot on video poker! While it is best never to get sick, I can't adequately describe how impressed I was with the responsiveness of the hotel staff, especially security, in our time of serious concern. We have stayed at Sam's Town for many years, and, hopefully, will stay there for many years. to come.

Reviews.Title: “You pay to have a place to sleep but you can't”
Reviews.Author: nancyta13
Reviews.Content: The rooms are average, not dirty but not super clean either. Furniture looks worn out and bed is hard, pillows are not comfortable. The common areas of the hotel look old and dirty, movie theater smelled like feet and saw a large cockroach at dunking donuts. Rooms that face outside have large windows with thin glass so you can hear the cars coming out of the parking lot at all hours at night (honking, blasting music, noisy large trucks, speeding) If you want to get a room facing the inside in order to not hear the noise, then you have to pay extra, with that extra and the resort fee you are better off paying a discounted room at a nicer and closer hotel somewhere else. Then, there is the noise from the halls, the entrance door to the rooms have a LARGE GAP (1 INCH) between the door and carpet, so you can hear housekeeping with their carts and maintenance coming and going, guests of other rooms opening and closing the door, and you can also hear anyone that is talking on the hallway. One of the nights I stayed some work was being done in a room next to mine AT 3 AM, when I called front desk the person, after putting me on hold for a while, said that they could move me to another room, meaning that I had to change clothes, pack my stuff, go to lobby with my luggage, ask for the change and then go to the new room. I said no because all that would take me at least 20 minutes to do; the "guest service specialist" told me that then there was nothing he could do, they were gonna keep working even in the middle of the night. When they were done and I was falling asleep (while also trying to ignore the cars coming out of the parking lot), the next ones making noise were stockers and housekeeping, then I slept for another while and a test for the fire alarms is on for about 12 minutes, 12 minutes of infernal noise at 10 am? In vegas? on vacation? If they knew there was gonna be noise in the area, why the hell did they put me in that room. The hotel is almost empty, there is no reason other than INCOMPETENCE FROM STAFF. I was gonna stay for 4 nights, but checked out after the second night. I am amazed that the front desk acts like the noise is no big deal. *I'm not a light sleeper, the noise really is annoying.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay”
Reviews.Author: catnip5268
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really nice. The room was nice - was not too crazy about the mattress but that was the only problem I had with the room. the room was big, roomy, clean and I had a great view. We really enjoyed eating at the Mexican Restaurant (willy's and Joses I think), the food was great and the waiter was such a happy guy he made eating there the more enjoyable. I would stay here again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok, Gambling was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: surfinginflorida
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sam’s Town on a trip with my parents. They like to be away from the strip, and this is a good hotel for that! The check-in was okay (they need some customer service lessons from Marriott!) I was given a room that wasn’t cleaned; had to go back downstairs and check-in again. The whole process of parking, check-in, getting the stuff to your room isn’t very convenient, but once you are in, Sam’s Town is self-contained with lots to offer. Didn’t do well gambling the first night, and dinner at the buffet was kind of blah. Not a good selection of vegetables, and lots of kids which can be kind of gross on a buffet (we had to notify the staff of yes, spoon licking on the line!) Watched the light show and considered watching a movie at the theater (nice to have that option!) Gambling the next day was much better – my mom won the free slot tournament; and my dad did well with video poker. The room is kind of drab…I think it is because it is supposed to be western/masculine. Not near as nice as the hotel rooms we have in Biloxi. So I’d give the hotel **, but the gambling hall ****.

Reviews.Title: “terrific hotel at excellent price”
Reviews.Author: sgbtravel
Reviews.Content: We had one night before picking up a camper in Las Vegas and needed a cheap place to stay. Sam's, at less than $35 a night was recommended and I expected a fleabag hote for that price. What a surprise! Sam's is a large hotel/restaurant/ movie/casino complex. The rooms in the multi story hotel are clean, large, well appointed--almost unbelievable what you get for that price. Really a first class hotel. We found a very decent place to eat within the complex and enjoyed a comfortable night's sleep before embarking on our camping trip.

Reviews.Title: “Sam's Town-Best Deal Going”
Reviews.Author: kbk9105
Reviews.Content: I am writing this, not as a shareholder or affiliate of Sam's Town Hotel and Casino, but a satisfied customer. Far too often the only reviews you read about an establishment, motel or any dealing with a commercial entity is that of total negativism. Living on the East Coast does not afford us the opportunity to visit the Las Vegas area nearly as often as we would like. We do seem to make the journey at least twice a year. In the past, my wife and I have had the opportunity to stay in many of the various hotels that the Las Vegas area has to offer. We have both agreed that the best all around value for our money is at Sam's Town Hotel and Casino, hands-down! That is why for the past 4 1/2 years, our choice accommodations was one less detail to be worked out prior to departing. The courtesy/friendliness of the entire staff begins months prior to actually arriving and continues throughout our stay. The amenities at the hotel are as accommodating as any of the overpriced establishments located in other portions of Las Vegas. The pride and professionalism displayed by each and every employee is overwhelming. The friendly and courteous servers in the restaurants to the dealers at the tables, exudes an attitude of "Welcome to Our House." In the past years, I have taken friends as well as business associates to Las Vegas; I have recommended/booked their rooms without hesitation at Sam's Town Hotel and Casino. I have never been disappointed. The gaming facilities have always been spotless; the effort of the staff to keep their assigned areas clean is simply amazing even on high-traffic weekends. The sports booking area is without question, one of the best in Las Vegas. The hotels security office maintains a constant friendly presence thus giving a sense of comfort while in the casino. The many restaurants are very much accommodating for any need and just about all tastes. Even though Sam's Town Hotel and Casino is not on the beaten path, the hotel does afford its guests the opportunity to see the other sites and casinos in the Las Vegas area with a complementary shuttle service to and from the Fremont Street area as well as strip. Would I recommend Sam's Town Hotel and Casino? Absolutely! Do I plan on staying at Sam's Town Hotel and Casino during my next vacation? Again, Absolutely! KK-Florida

Reviews.Title: “Great value, but rooms are hit or miss”
Reviews.Author: MooreFamilyPhxAZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Sam's Town during the beginning and ending legs of our trip through Las Vegas. The location was excellent and the renovated portion of the hotel was really updated, clean and nice, although they did charge too much for internet access. I slept great on the comfy bed and would give the hotel an A rating based upon on our first night in the renovated section. However, our second stay in the older section was a completely opposite experience. The bed was one of the worst I'd ever slept on and the room was very undesirable, not to mention that the people in the next room were noisy and kept banging things around their room. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you're planning a visit to Vegas as it was a fantastic value, but only if you stay in a renovated room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, quiet place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dodg1988
Reviews.Content: If you go to Vegas and are tired of packs of crowds on the strip, Sam's Town is a perfect remedy. Rooms are pretty nice, the staff has always been great, and they have a bowling alley that is open all night.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping barged into our room when we were sleepin”
Reviews.Author: ktinbc
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for last night from a promo that I received by e-mail. The room was ready and pleasant when we arrived. We decided to take our 2 kids bowling, and after waiting half hour we got a lane with bumpers. Only one side worked, but a maintenance worker showed us how pull the other side up. When we were almost finished (3 frames to go) we got kicked off our lane to make room for a league. I asked if we could just finish our game, but we couldn't. The lane that was available didn't have bumpers that worked. So we had to finish our few frames without bumpers. Then the man at the desk complained at us for messing with the old lane bumper. By the time we left, the league still had not arrived. The rest of the night was fine. However, at about 8am the next morning we got a knock at the door. It took me a minute to get across the room to answer it, but the door was flung open before I could get there. There was a woman standing there with a notepad and namebadge apologizing about entering our room. I was stunned, as she was, and I forgot to get her name. My husband WAS asleep, my kids were getting dressed. I felt this was extremely inappropriate for the staff to open the doors to rooms that are occupied. Check out time is noon, and it was only 8:00. I asked for the hotel policy at the front desk, and the man who helped me was very nice. He called the housekeeping supervisor and was informed that they were checking rooms to find unoccupied rooms that they could clean early. However, he blamed me for the mistake because I had not placed the “do not disturb” sign on the door, and I had not put the night-time lock on. So, it was my fault that the staff barged into my room with me and my children. Unacceptable. After packing up and leaving the room, we decided to visit the pool. It was 11:50am (checkout time is noon), but we were locked out of the pool. Our key would not work! It worked for me about 2 hours prior, but not at 10 minutes before checkout time. This was our first visit to Sam’s Town and we are locals. After this experience, we don’t think we will return, or advise anyone else to visit your hotel. I saw that the hotel was very busy, but there are plenty other places to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great for overnight”
Reviews.Author: grayback
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our way back to seattle. Great for the price! Friendly and helpful staff. Buffet was not good, pick & choose food carefully!

Reviews.Title: “Our Favourite Place in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: pickybit
Reviews.Content: We love to stay at Sam's Town!!! I have 3 kids (12, 13 & 15) and Sam's has plenty for them to do. We go bowling, to the movies, watch the laser show and go to the pool all in one hotel. Of course, there is the casino for the big "kids". There are many restaurants to choose from, as well - McDonald's, TGI Fridays, Billy Bob's, Subway, Dunkin Donuts, Calamity Jane's Ice Cream, Firelight Buffet, and more. There is a huge Wal Mart Supercentre just across the street. It is only 10 minutes to the Strip and 15 minutes to the Premium Outlet Mall. We always get 2 adjoining rooms which gives us a little space. A few years ago we stayed at the MGM Grand which was very nice, but other than the massive bathroom the room was the same size. It was too hectic up on the strip. We prefer to be at Sam's where it is a little quieter and we don't have to walk a mile to the pool. There are no room safes (which would be nice), but they do have safe deposit boxes at the cashiers cage. Also, there is smoking at the pool which is not nice for non-smokers - especially kids. It would be nice to enjoy the fresh air without someone blowing smoke in your face. In the casino you can get up and move is someone smokes next to you, but there isn't any place at the pool that is non-smoking. One other thing that would be nice is automatic doors at the parkade. The doors are heavy and it is hard to manage when you have your hands full of luggage. Thankfully, we have kids to hold the doors open for us, but if you have a handicap it would be almost impossible to manage the door alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Everyone”
Reviews.Author: motherhood2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Sam's Town many times over the years. This latest trip was for a Vegas wedding and included family from back east that had never been to Vegas. The brides family all stayed at Sam's and we were very happy we did. We hosted a breakfast buffet for 40 at the Firelight Buffet and the service was excellent. We had a birthday party celebration at TGI Fridays and the food and service were great. We got players cards for our guests and the senior members of the party took advantage of 50 plus Thursday with free slot tournaments, etc. We had a great time gambling and playing bingo. Our guests loved the park and the laser show and were very impressed with the bowling facility. After all the positive comments from our guests and the hospitality shown us by our casino host we were truly satisfied with all aspects of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “honest review of Sam's Town”
Reviews.Author: LVpoker
Reviews.Content: Decided this trip to try something new away from the strip and downtown. Chose Sam's Town based on reviews and price. First off the cab ride from the airport runs about the same as a cab ride downtown ($23) so not too bad. The check-in process was relatively smooth, no big line and 4 people working the desk. Pretty much no wait at all. When checking in we were offered an upgrade. We were told the room we booked was a "standard" room although the reservation said "deluxe". We were told that for $25/night extra we could move to a "premium" room. Since it was our anniversary we opted for the upgrade only to find the room to identical to the picture of the room we booked online for $25/night less. Not sure what we paid for with that "upgrade" although we were told were getting a premium room with a great view of their atrium show. (At checkout our final bill did not include the charge for the upgrade. We did not complain about the charge or request it be refunded so perhaps it was just an error on their part or since it was our anniversary the charge was dropped). We never saw a "standard" room but according to other reviews it is a basic "motel" type room. Our room was nice with a coffee maker, refrigerator and a plasma television. Overall quality of the room was excellent although it was very comparable to a room at The Orleans which can usually be reserved for half what we were supposed to pay at Sam's Town. The casino is huge quiet for the most part. No problem for the wife to find her favorite slot machines to play and rarely, if ever anybody on them. Tables were very quiet with only a couple of blackjack tables going, 1 craps table and maybe a Pai Gow table going depending on the time of day. At night the number would maybe move up by 1 table for each game but not a seriously active table game atmosphere. Poker room is quiet at all times of day and night. Most times 1 game of 2-4 limit but they try to get a stud game going later at night. Poker tournaments there attract a local crowd. I played 1 evening and only 7 players signed up for the tournament making it quite uneventful. Bottom line about he casino is this. There is not a ton of action going on there which is good for slot players but bad for table players. Food selection is decent although I was not impressed with the buffet. Tried it 1 time for breakfast. Neither me or the wife was impressed and we decided not to try the lunch or dinner based solely on the quality of the breakfast. There is a food court as well as a steak house and mexican restaurant. We actually ate off property other than grabbing something light at the food court but the other restaurants looked decent enough to try. Pool was nothing spectacular but was nice and would be suitable for use. Do not expect wave pools, shark tanks, island bars in the middle, blackjack tables or anything like that. It is a swimming pool and there were chairs to use around it. Not flashy but clean and there were plenty of people enjoying it so must be adequate. There is a theater and a bowling alley on property also which gives folks something other than feeding slot machines and dancing with drunk college students for entertainment options. Free shuttles tot he strip and downtown are a great selling point to stay here. If you are looking for a quiet experience, away from the strip in an atmosphere of locals then this is a relatively decent place. The atrium is very nice and the show they put on there is pretty cool to watch. I would consider staying there again but I would not be willing to pay the extra charge for a room that matches the picture of the cheaper rooms they advertise online. But, for the right price it is a very decent alternative to the strip or downtown if you are looking for some decent slot action and a little peace and quiet. No major complaints from me, the staff is friendly, the slot machines payoff and the free shuttles make getting around town fairly simple.

Reviews.Title: “always a great stay”
Reviews.Author: loretta97487
Reviews.Content: we have been staying at samstown in henderson for years. our stay is always the best. the rooms are always nice, clean, and the beds very comfortable..the maids are always very helpful and friendly and seem to be very honest..but what amazes me is every time,, not most of the time but every time we pull up and announce that 'we are home' the bell desk is right there for our things. the valet is right there to move the car and we have no worrries, except to get inside and begin our gambling marathon. there is three bellman who are awesome and i can only think of ones name but that is adam, they do an awesome job every time. we get checked in and call them and in just short minutes they are there with our bags so we can get back to gambling..they are the best and if sams wanted to put this crew up against any in vegas i would put my money on them being the winner. the food is always good, the buffet is clean and well stocked with good eats, and billy bobs is an institution all its own..we love the food and the service, a very marketable place...the gambling is good, i can still lose there but i have such a great time doing it and we play bingo all day each day we are there so i gamble on the even hours and late in the evening and into the morning..like i said this not a one time event. this has been going on for years. last year we were there three times but this year looks like only this once but who knows, we can hope anyway...we love sams and tell everyone who says they are going to vegas that they should try sams. you know you want your friends and aquaintances to enjoy the best. anyway our stays are always memorable and only in the best of ways. so thank you and see you as soon as possible but for sure next june.....

Reviews.Title: “The Park, the waterfall, the light show, bowling, the pool, and friendly staff make a wonderful family trip.”
Reviews.Author: Corlettjs
Reviews.Content: Sam’s Town is our favorite place to stay in the Las Vegas area, and this month, it became the favorite of our adult children, their friends, and our grandson. We reserved two rooms and a space in the RV park, and we all had a great time. Sam’s Town is the most child-friendly hotel-casino we know of. Our 3-year-old grandson loved the indoor park, the waterfall, and the electronic wild animals, especially the mountain lion. He made up a story about the lone deer fawn standing near the mine shaft, and, while sitting on his daddy’s shoulders, he saw the laser show exclaiming, “Wow!” as he watched the water shoot up toward the ceiling. He also bowled for the first at the Sam’s Town bowling alley where bumpers automatically arose on each side of the alley when it was his turn to bowl. In honor of his first spare, his dad took him to the Sheplar’s Western Wear store inside Sam’s Town where he purchased a small toy horse. None of us went hungry at Sam’s Town. One of our thirty-something children said the “Billy Bob’s” steak was the best he had ever had…and he is a real carnivore. Our waiter was attentive and was patient with our little diner for whom he recommended a child’s dinner just suited to him. The Fireside Buffet is wonderful and truly inexpensive. Another of the older sons feasted on the crab legs at the buffet. The plate was heaped with the critters. Sam’s Town is just the best. And the machines and tables at Sam’s are as friendly as the rest of the place. We will be back. In our minds there is no better casino in LasVegas.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Suite”
Reviews.Author: Iowegian9
Reviews.Content: For 45 bucks Sam's was a bargain. Easy parking. Friendly staff. We drove to The Strip and saw the pretty lights, then retired to Sam's for a quiet drink and a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not for long stays”
Reviews.Author: ChrisTCPD
Reviews.Content: Pros: Plenty of food choices (food all over, 24/7) Plenty of Parking (Three parking garages) Affordable Rates ($60 on weekend) Walmart across the street. Good for those last minute items. Very quiet location and hotel. Cons: Pillows were ROCKS. I'm not just saying they were hard. They were ROCKS. Bed was hard. Not as bad as the pillows but still very hard. Like wood. Pool was dirty. Lots of bottle caps and litter around. Hot tub was foamy. Definitely not good! Getting to room was difficult. Have to go all the way through the casino if you park at one garage. Definitely park at garage 2. All-in-all, I'd probably not stay again just because of the bedding. Sleep is important and we all slept like crap because of the bedding.

Reviews.Title: “The Suite Life on vacation at Sam's”
Reviews.Author: Firstnten
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sam's Town for 3 nights May 27-29 and had a comp to a 1-bedroom Jacuzzi Suite with an interior park view of the Sunset Stampede laser light and water show. What an impressive suite: full wet bar with built in refrigerator, 3 nice bar stools at the marble bar, full glass dining room table with 4 chairs, in the living room a nice sofa and chair and an enormous TV which had to be 60-65 inches, a king size bed in the bedroom with another TV built into the large armoire, floor to ceiling windows, a big Jacuzzi on the other side of the bedroom with neat Brick, glass, brass, and mirror features. Also, in the bathroom were double sinks with marble, a nice water closet, a sitting area with a stool, a glass enclosed shower with a small bench, and next to the regular toilet was yes, hold your hat, a bidet!! I have vacationed in Las Vegas a dozen times and this was the nicest accomodations that I have ever had. Met up with a couple of my hosts and had a decent meal at TGI Fridays, and also had a vary nice steak dinner at Billy Bob's and I would highly recommend--the baked potatoes are massive. The Buffet, only so-so, for breakfast they close/rope off many of the food stations and won't let you have a salad. I noticed that the food was ready, packed in ice, had plastic wrap over the salads but was roped off for breakfast. Unlike the South Point where you can have everything for breakfast, lunch, and dinner!! The slots were extremely tight, very little play or bounce to them, and believe me I'm a slot player. The people are friendly and laid back, but security is all around as this neighborhood has a bit of a vagrant/homeless crowd often coming onto the property, Check in and out was quick and professional, 2 thumbs up. I had a $100.00 free food coupon to burn up, and 1 person told me that it was good for food and drinks and a second person said no, only for food only?? I never got a 100% answer, but I think that my Casino Executive Host took care of any loose ends. The pool area is vary nice with a medium size pool, a hottub, towel service, plenty of chairs, and a small outside bar with 1 male bartender.Attn: Sam's Town--Where are the poolside cocktail service gals?? All in all a good trip and the accomodations were the highlight of my Las Vegas vacation.

Reviews.Title: “SAM'S TOWN IN LAS VEGAS IS AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: mgonzalez349
Reviews.Content: You can find hotels and Casinos that are clean, that are reasonably priced and maybe a few nice employees, but let me tell you you put all the great things that are offered at Sam's Town and also include the nicest and most helpful employees of any Casinol in Las Vegas and you have a Fantastic Vegas Vacation. Not only is this place gorgeous but everyone that I spoke with,, asked a question or asked for help was so courteous and friendly I thought "Am I really in Vegas?" I highly recommend Sam's Town to anyone looking for a great time, great gambling, great entertainment and service with a smile. Love this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a deal for the money!”
Reviews.Author: 3chihuahuas
Reviews.Content: We had gambled at Sam’s Town, but never stayed in the hotel. We were already coming to Vegas (driving in from LA area) for my hubby’s birthday, Sunday, May 2nd to stay comped at Orleans, which is another Boyd property. We had a chance to arrive on Saturday, so when I checked the B-Connected account on-line the day before, there was a room deal for hubby for his birthday month at Sam’s. $35.00 for the room on a Saturday night, with no minimum stay – couldn’t beat that deal with a stick! We arrived late Sat night, had no one in line at the desk – super nice guy – gave us room 978 on the top floor, park side (usually an extra charge). Neat, clean room – we had a good sized flat panel TV, however the armoire that held the old tube TV (with drawers on bottom) was still in the room – sorta strange to have that large empty space where the TV was…..the bed was a bit hard and the pillows flat, but I would not hesitate to stay again. We gambled at bit that night and were actually up, but gave it back the next morning….CW service was non-existent in the wee hours of the morning. After 8:30 am I could not keep up with the drink service. They make a killer Miami Vice! Had breakfast at the buffet – the champagne brunch. With your players card, it’s less than $10.00. Food was actually pretty good (except scrambled eggs – I think those were powdered), but they had plenty of selections, an omelet station and free flowing champagne, even if it was served in a plastic glass! I’d always liked Sam’s Town and now after staying in the hotel, I like them even more. Just be aware, it is out on the Boulder Hwy, some distance from the Strip or Downtown – very much a locals and low-rollers place – if you need glitz & glamour with the beautiful people running around – you won’t like it. We'll spend more time next time around at Sam's. The staff was the most friendly I'd seen in long time - lots of smiles that appeared geniune.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute great experience”
Reviews.Author: devidig
Reviews.Content: Always have a great time at Sam's Town. My hostess is a wonderful gal and I always feel right at home!!

Reviews.Title: “Quality is starting to slip”
Reviews.Author: Phillygwm
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Sam's Town many times over the years and have never been disappointed. After my most recent visit, I'm concerned the place may be slipping. Check-in was delayed because my room wasn't ready, then every day during my stay, housekeeping was late to make up the room. On my last night there, I had to call down at 6:00 PM because the room was never touched. All in all, an OK stay (I particularly enjoy Billy Bob's and Willy & Jose's restaurants) but I wonder if they're starting to cut corners...

Reviews.Title: “What more could you ask for....”
Reviews.Author: Juddie73
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sam's town for 7 nights. Found the hotel to be very clean, the staff polite and helpfull, the facilities first rate... the bowling alley and the theater were fantastic. The resturants on site are good value with great food and service. This would have to represent the best value stay I have had anywhere... you could not go wrong with Sam's Town!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as expected for 40 bucks a night!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah417
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sam's Town for 4 nights in April of 2010 during the week. With the "resort fee" of $4.50 a night the rooms were just under $40 (weekday rates) Since it was my birthday, we got a free upgrade to a suite. The room was average, but had a hot-tub, and a view of the laser show. It was clean, but certainly not a luxury room. (the free upgrade put us on a smoking floor, which we did not appreciate... but the room did not smell of smoke) If you stay at Sam's Town, make sure you have a rental vehicle. Although they offer a free shuttle down to the strip, the shuttle ends at 11:00 - which was a problem for our night-owl friends, and a cab from the strip costs $35! The hotels on the strip do offer free valet parking, so it wasn't a big deal. (but tipping valets does add up quickly!) My husband played at the blackjack tables, which had a $5 buy-in (the lowest we saw in Vegas) The first night, the dealer was terrible, very rude. The second night he played again, and the dealer was fantastic! It was entertaining just to play at the table! If you stay, be sure to sign up for a club card, it will get you a discount on the buffet. We ate at the buffet twice, once for dinner and once for breakfast. The dinner buffet was ok, but the breakfast buffet is well worth the price. Every breakfast item you could want is offered, and omelets are made to order. (be sure to get there early, the lines are long!) For the price paid, we were expecting much less. We did have a rental vehicle for the week, so the distance to the strip wasn't a problem for us. We had some luck on the slots at Sam's Town too. We did appreciate having a variety of restaurants in the facility, and ate at the TGIFridays twice. You can also purchase beers here for $2, which is outstanding, compared to the $7 on the strip. Overall, the hotel stay was adequate for the price paid. (but I do think next time, we will spend a bit more to stay directly on the strip) It is an affordable option for travelers wanting to get away from the hustle and bustle of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal - booked via hotel”
Reviews.Author: SpaVisitor3
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights late April. Walls are a bit thin - last two nights I could hear the woman in the next room and she wasn't being overly loud - just a medium pitched voice. Used my earplugs. Other than that it was a quiet stay on the 7th floor. Staff - oh my- talk about friendly and personable. Room toiletries - no conditioner or shower hats but they did have shampoo, body lotion and soap. Room was clean - vents and carpet-meets-the-wall areas could use a vacuuming but not that bad at all. Two queen bed room - plenty of room - better than your average Motel 6 and the like. Not a glitzy crowd at all. Mostly families and middle aged to senior folks. Nice easy pace feeling. Note - if you have scent issues, beware - there were areas on the main floor and also on the second floor (walk around area) that were just reeking of something strong and fragrant. I'm not sensitive to fragrance usually but it bothered me. Wasn't everywhere though. And what's with this Jon and Ric's Salon? The whole time I was there the place was closed with a note on the door with a cell number to call. Parking garages - more than one, and tons of free parking. Here's a tip that will save you unnecessary exercise! Garage 2 - the floor numbers don't match up with the hotels. The garage level 2 is on the hotel's level 3, which has a separate set of elevators and a pedway over the street. When you check out, if you are driving, bring all of your luggage to your car first, as without your pass card, you can't get to any of the hotel elevators to get back up to the garage pedway. (Not that I was told - might need to send a hex towards a particular security guard if that's not so.) I asked for and got two extra blankets to use. There is Internet connection available through some third party group - $10 for a 24 hour period. On the heavily scented second floor (or it may be the third floor now that I think about it), there are computers with printers. I used the internet connection with my laptop but due to tech difficulties couldn’t log on the first time I tried. Issue was resolved by the time I got back to the room later that day, but I did get booted out a couple of times. Never saw a luggage rack or porter the whole stay. I found it cheaper to book through the hotel, and two days after I did, I got an email notice advertising lower rates and some comps (Ha! Casino talk!). I phoned the reservations folks and had no problem getting the lower rate and $25 food credit offered. Can’t do that on Expedia. Food - Porterhouse steak at Billy Bob's was REALLY good. Baked potato was ...meh. Firelight buffet - ate there once - not bad but I should have passed on paying the $3 extra dollars to add the New York steak option. It wasn't much better than average, and they were serving beef anyway. Bathroom in the average room - if you are in to tub soaking and are more than a size 8, don't get your hopes up. The tub is oval and just seemed to squeeze me together. Only uncomfortable bath tub I've ever sat in. Shower was great. Completely sold me on getting one of those curved curtain rods! Location - it was what I wanted - off the strip, near the freeways so I could get to everything I wanted. About a 10-15 minute drive to the strip directly down Flamingo, and note that one of the garages exits out on Flamingo. About 20 minutes to the Premium outlet mall (see review on that). Bed wasn't the softest but I've been on much harder. Pillows were fine even though I still brought my own. They weren't hard pillows in the room I had. Seventh floor is non smoking but two guys I spoke with said their room must have been venting smoke in from somewhere as their stuff, and the pillows smelled smoky. I should have asked what room that was....for the smoke issue, of course... View - overlooked one of the parking garages if you looked down. If you looked up/straight ahead, the view was of the mountains. I chose to look up. Some areas on the main floor were smoky but the restaurants were fine. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired, and just "okay"”
Reviews.Author: GigiPearl
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a king bed room overlooking the parking garage. Used soap and open shampoo bottle still in the bathtub from the previous guests ~ I should have complained. It did make me think that the tub had not been cleaned at all. Also a little ticked at the "hotel fee" of $4.50. A little steep on a $29.99 advertised room rate. Why not just add it to the rate?

Reviews.Title: “My most awesome trip.”
Reviews.Author: jellybeanalberta
Reviews.Content: My Heavens if anyone out there would love a great stay and lots of fun just go to Sams Town Hotel and Gambling, My experience there was so wonderful. It takes your breath away just to walk into the Atrium and see the water show and the animals, See the Waterfall and the Laser show. and relax as it all takes place, Just to see the animals as they have made them is exciting and truly quite an experience. Being in Las Vegas at the other Hotels I have come to love Sams Town the most and would rate anything from the Casino to the Rooms to the Food which is great and the Atrium as nothing but Excellent, Excellent. The Casino is so huge and you have your pick of any machine as there are so many. Thank You for making my stay in Las vegas such a memorial experience. I will be back for sure, and hopefully longer next time, Thank You Carolyn Rhindress-- Edmonton, Alberta Canada and Mary Alexander--- Cambridge Ontario We are sisters who were there together,

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned, poor rooms, but well maintained.”
Reviews.Author: tropicana49
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen because it was close to a family activity and the trip was short (2 days). It is many miles (and stop lights) from the strip. The rooms are small and very outdated -- tiny televisions, etc. They also are noisy from the free laser show that occurs many times per night. There is no internet access. The pool is small and mostly shaded. It is also in a dangerous neighborhood (I was advised by the bell man to get a newspaper from the front desk, as it was "safer" that going to a Walgreens a block away). The good points -- there is a 24 hour grill that has great food at very reasonable prices. Also, the pay scales on the video poker machines are far better than those at any strip casino. There is an ice cream parlor (although it closes early) and a modern multi-screen theater on site. If you avoid spending much time in your room, this hotel is a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “If Hotel was Not in Vegas, I would Have Been Happy to Never Leave the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: akidcagal
Reviews.Content: Sam's Town is Great! It has a beautifully maintaned bowling alley with $1.00 shoes and games after midnight, a 24-hour deli with great food and value (except the 50 cent charge for a to-go container is pretty ridiculous), a decent buffet for the price, a nice gaming floor, large & comfortable rooms, and more. The pool looked good but we did not swim as the weather was a bit windy and cool (Early April) as it always seems to be that time of year. The indoor "park" has waterfalls, rocks, and vegetation and really looks and feels like being in nature. The laser light show at 2, 6, 8 & 10 is wonderful and very patriotic. Funny thing is that since Vegas has so much to do, we only finally took in the laser show on our last night there. It is a must see! The hotel staff were excellent and accomodating. The dealers were very friendly. Overall we had a great time. I wish I could say that everyone we encountered in Vegas were as top-notch as the people at Sam's Town, but they were not. I will review other places we visited as well. The hotel set-up is a bit hard to navigate when going from the parking garage to your room but you might get the hang of it as we did. Basically floor #3 from the parking garage elevator is the same as floor #2 in the hotel elevator. You must have your room key to access the hotel in some areas but none is needed to use the ice machines. Although the weekday room prices were great, beware as they do add a $4.50 service fee for each day. Wi-fi is also $10.00 for a 24-hour period. And, of course, 50 cents to get a to-go container to take your deli food to your room (really crazy). But hey, it is Vegas where they are experts at getting your money. The location is on Boulder Highway away from downtown and the strip but it is an easy 10-15 minute drive to just about anywhere in town. There is a super Walmart across the street which was nice to get snacks and drinks at. Also, the local gas stations seem to have some of the lowest in Las Vegas. Basically Sams Town has some residential areas around it and a lot of the locals go there. I even gambled along side some dealers from other casinos who were in Sam's Town on their day off. Although I did not go to the bars, the music sounded great from the one. It was a western band. Overall I love Sam's Town and will always opt to stay here away from the crowds of the strip and in a safe-feeling, enclosed "town." Since there was so much we could have done at Sam's Town, I was almost disappointed that we were gone so much doing stuff in the greater Las Vegas area. If you want a comfortable & home-town type, anti-glamourous Vegas experience, then go to Sam's Town. They do make you feel right at home.

Reviews.Title: “Sam's Town is my place.”
Reviews.Author: dandydon27
Reviews.Content: I was at Sam's Town for March Madness, what a great place. I've been staying here twice a year for the past 15 years. Always get treated like a king.

Reviews.Title: “Sams Town, not the place it used to be!!”
Reviews.Author: Seminole1
Reviews.Content: SAMS TOWN- has gone way down in service, attitude of slot reps, and most of all gaming. everyone seems slow to do their jobs and management seems to placate a few of their favorites but not willing to extend favors to the up and comers. Best thing about Sams Town-Mystic Falls.

Reviews.Title: “A place that you will enjoy”
Reviews.Author: ElenaSellers
Reviews.Content: rooms are great. You don't have to go any where else. lots to see at Sam's Town

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast!”
Reviews.Author: jettz
Reviews.Content: Took a taxi to the Alladin & got the taxi driver, that played in "Ghost Dad"!! Holy Smokes!! What a wild ride...

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Magic with Mystic Falls room at Sams Town”
Reviews.Author: FuntimesX2
Reviews.Content: We are locals. Every December we stay overnight at Sams Town in a room with a view of Mystic Falls which is magnificent at Christmas. It has about three free shows a night from it's gorgeous waterfall & now it's all decorated for the holidays! There's a giant decorated Christmas tree, animatronic animals in winter scenes, lights everywhere. Some views are far better than others, the extra fee ($10) is the same regardless of your view. The higher up you are the better, one side is better than the other, too. The ends are not real good. We got the side that is not as good this time. The view was nice, however, except for the waterfall did not face us, We were dissapointed. But the rate was so great we couldn't be too upset. The room is very large, very clean and always a pleasure to stay in. Check in is easy, check out is a breeze! The beds are stiff, though, our only complaint. Billy Bob's restaurant is right by the waterfall, we always have dinner there, fantastic restaurant! Such a treat. Service is outstanding, the food is so delicious. There's bowling if lanes are available, my husband enjoys that. They have movie theaters, it's a great time.
